YWZrav6Do7MQP1Arfjto3A.text: The servers here are always very friendly and knowledgeable about their food. They have a few veggie items on their menu. On my last visit I had the veggie fried rolls and the Bok Choy Ginger soup which was siprisingly tasty given it's simplicity. My boyfriend really likes their Pho Ga. *Note: the spring rolls come with warm marinated meat which I do not care for.

PWTiwdl-HW00oA7UnZRCVg.text: I've finally had a chance to come back to this restaurant and try their pho.  The service was still amazing so I feel somewhat guilty, but I'm going with 2 stars.  After all, pho is the main factor here.  I was really disappointed by their pho.  The broth was bland and lacked flavor.  The meat was okay, but the portions were a bit small.  I'm gonna have to stick with Central King Eggroll for pho - the only place I've found in AZ that is even close to CA pho quality.

1SVCJditHAm5-JuCZqDIbw.text: My husband introduced me to this place and I can't get enough of their egg rolls! I love the fresh ingredients used and the simplicity of the dishes. Yum. The servers are extremely nice and always helpful in case I need advice on something to eat! ;)  John is always a pleasure so hopefully you'll get the chance to have him serve you! ojxkVpW4EcurQ3k0YnEXOQ.text: I'm always satisfied with the food here.  Everything I've tried here were decent.  Pho, Vermicelli, rice plates, vietnamese stir-fry.

M6VIBetYkzUk4EyT3oQqJA.text: Excellent Vietnamese food. Try the fresh coconut milk too!

B0a31YBKDEHkpE6YI34Hxg.text: This is the BEST vietnamese restaurant in west valley! Their food taste very authentic. The atmosphere is very cozy. The service is outstanding!

O-MG6vNH1x1pGjUB9FCm8g.text: I love Little Saigon! Heard about it from my doc and went the same night. We've probably been back at least a dozen times. The ambiance is adorable (makes a great date place), prices EXTREMELY reasonable and the food is awesome. You truly can't go wrong but I advise sticking to the traditional dishes for the most bang!

tPkQYFARYI65AFShywTkMg.text: At first sight, you can't help but fall in love with this cute little restaurant. It was my very first experience eating vietnamese food, so I already was pretty nervous. Our server was very quick at getting our drinks and answering any questions we had. Overwhelmed, by the amount of options I decided to play it safe and choose a noodle stir fry. I am not a picky eater by any means, but I wanted to make sure I started out with something I knew I would like. When my meal came out I realized that I had accidentally ordered the flat noodles instead of the egg noodles. When our server returned I apologized about my mix up and asked how to not make the same mistake next time when ordering. He took my plate back to change the noodles and quickly returned with a new plate of food. I noticed that an older gentlemen, who turned out to be the owner, was following behind. I expected him to ask how my food was, but NO he came up to my chair and began yelling at me. He yelled at me for not choosing the correct dish the first time and said next time I come in I better choose right the first time and not waste his money/food. I was completely shaken up. I have NEVER been yelled at anyone at a restaurant...let alone an owner. I was completely embarrassed because there were other customers seated around us.   I never will go back to this restaurant again. The customer service from the server was great, but I was completely disrespected and deeply embarrassed by the owner. No one should ever get yelled at or have their feelings hurt when they go out to eat especially by the owner.   Very sad and disappointed.

RUFj0f3sLfabqNANg1chkA.text: Wonderful! Down from Sacramento for Spring Training and felt like a little Pho, which is plentiful in Sactown. This place was quaint, in an old house. Little rooms of tables. Fast service! We started with the pot stickers, which were homemade and fresh. Very tasty. the Pho was great, too. The nice lady who took our order was very great. My spousal equivalent is not a fan of fish. When he ordered a noodle dish that sounded tasty, she gave us a heads up that is has a strong flavor of fish sauce. Tragedy averted; he ordered something else. I could not finish my noodles and a take-out dish was promptly offered. Very pleased with our dinner; give it a try!

xxO7yjxdlICK3dZmdiNXuA.text: i drove by that area many times.. and i always thought it was someone's home.. =  ) food is great.. been going there since 2007..  spring roll is great.. peanut sauce.. mmmm...  i usually get ice coffee,  spring roll, and garlic shrimp..  i have tried almost everything on their menu..  few are good.. few are.. so so..   family owned place..  servers are great! love the older man who cooks in the kitchen.. i believe he is the main owner, and his son and wife are the servers..  they are awesome..    i love it when cook gets upset and start yelling!! it is like dinner and show!! =  )    if you like tofu.. try their glazed onion tofu.. it is crispy outside.. and soft inside.. man.. now i am getting hungry!!!  price is fair.. food is awesome.. great service.. perfect winning combo!!

yl_-dNycBsmHbpdoLiDSXg.text: This was my first time eating pho and I loved it. My friend who is a bit more of a pho connoisseur said it was definitely above average with a good taste to it. The spring rolls were delicious and we got an egg noodle dish that was very nice-not too greasy which I like.   We also loved the outdoor seating on the patio under a lit up tree (jazz music from the coffee shop across the street added to the ambiance). I would definitely go back.

Oe9IxK7-A1b3l56gKAM5Ig.text: I've been dying to try this place and finally made it for lunch today - Wow - Awesome! We had the egg rolls and Pho Ga - Excellent - everything was fresh and tasted amazing ;-) Everyone was really nice and welcoming... I will definitely be back!

61E7fbSYyPo9y0wYeCCOKw.text: Their hours were posted as closing at 3:00 pm.  We got there at 2:40 and were refused entry, with the host saying that they stop seating people at 2:30.  If that's the case, why don't they post closing hours as 2:30?  My family use to run a restaurant and our customers and business were important to us.  If someone came 5 or 10 or more minutes after our posted closing, we would still welcome them.  In this economy, the majority of restaurants we have gone to have gone out of their way to provide good service.  I guess this place doesn't need or value the business.  I'm giving them 1 star only because someone recommended this place but I will not be returning to see what we missed.  There are plenty of excellent Vietnamese restaurants in the Phoenix area.

xFB3VQ1oJrwTqY4agyQKKg.text: I can't add much to the great reviews, except I had to rave about Little Saigon!  I've tried a few Vietnamese restaurants on the west side, then my hubby stumbled across Little Saigon on his first trip to Yelpland.  Located in charming downtown Glendale only two miles from home, we went there on a Saturday night.  There is a generous patio with lovely twinkle lights, and you can hear the music from the coffee shop across the street.  The interior is bright and cheerful, with, I think, 3 rooms.  The place was almost full - always a good sign, and a very friendly waiter seated us and took our drink orders.  The menu is generous, and the prices reasonable.  We shared spring rolls and potstickers.  Best spring roll ever, methinks: not too much lettuce as filler, delish pork and shrimp that tastes like it once swam, with a light peanut sauce that does not overwhelm.  The potstickers were also great - generously filled with tasty pork and veggies, complimented by a mild Asian BBQ sauce.  We were off to a good start.  Hubs, who is new to Vietnamese cuisine, and who gets props for trying, chose a pan fried rice noodle dish with meat (at least chicken and shrimp) and veggies.  He thoroughly enjoyed it, generously offering me one bite, and pretending not to notice when I stole a couple more.   Just as my bench-mark dish for rating Thai restaurants is Pad Thai, my dish for Vietnamese food is Bun Thit Nuong (or Bun Thit Heo Nuong here).  My bowl had all the right stuff: tender, flavorful grilled pork (not a speck of gristle - a first in Phoenix!), lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, mint, and julienned cukes, vermicelli and sauce.  I love the sweet, vinegary sauce that comes with Bun Thit Nuong, and my sweet server told me the ingredients.  It was simply so very good.  Little Saigon has the whole package:  clean, cute, friendly and attentive service, and excellent food.  We can't wait to go back and try some of the other things on the menu, and mentioned in Yelp reviews.  Can you say "Yum, yum", Dum Dum?

c4z3Kglq5jwusgxBZUuWSg.text: Love the food here. It is small but worth it. John is a great person to talk with and the staff really knows the menu. I go here at least once a week.

HzMV-i__OJATVN00_4QzQA.text: I am more critical to this restaurant than some of other reviewers here. I do not think the Phos  we had tonight were that good. The soup was pretty plain, #12 had a lot of low quality beef with large amount of fat. To be honest, this place has been overrated and does not deserve the high marks.

Fp7XKFEGE62l548VJUTzvA.text: Vietnamese restaurants are not traditionally known for their ambiance, but this one really made me feel at home. Although some of the tables are pretty close to each other, it is a very comfortable environment. The dining experience was much nicer than I expected! My favorite Vietnamese dish is the vermicelli bowl with pork, and I also always get spring rolls. The meal here was one very good. It didn't meet up to my all-time favorite (Pho Tau Bay in New Orleans) and I think Da Vang makes it slightly better, but it was very good. The spring rolls were much better than those at the other places I've tried. (Sidenote: Really, how hard is it to make these? How can places like Saigon Nites and Cyclo not make them as good as me? And I'm a Cajun that learned by reading the back of a spring roll wrapper container!) My companion thoroughly enjoyed the boba tea; I didn't think it was worth the money, as it was only so-so. I did enjoy a good Vietnamese beer, but I don't remember what kind it was. Other than the beverages, the prices were reasonable. As mentioned by others, it's hard to find a place to park, but it's definitely a great place to eat (quality and price) if you are in downtown Glendale.

y-En0OLIG4QDsrFMJfnFHQ.text: This restaurant was clean, and nice, the service was good. However, stay away from the bun bo hue, it was a disaster. I've never tasted anything so horrible!!! The pho was decent though, I've never tried anything else there. I will probably not come back.

H8W5YGqL8SUzwfJhGOhnvw.text: I had a lunch here today,  it was worth to burn the gas from Avondale. I ordered #24 (Stir fry rice noodle with meats and veges), OMG it was soooo good, but the portion was smaller than I expected. I think I can eat here every week,  I like to try rice noodle soup (Pho) next time.

nBoIpY4mnOyGWKM56dOtww.text: I miss good Vietnamese food and after being offered some unappetizing food at a conference nearby this was a welcomed sight! I drank the Boba Thai Iced Tea, Shrimp summer rolls, and curry. It was a party in my mouth! It felt like home! I cannot wait until it gets cooler to try their Pho! Drooling just thinking about returning!

MwXuBQBD-NJbizt8sQc77Q.text: Good Afternooooon, Vietnam!  Did somebody say lunch time?  Somewhere I heard someone say something about some food.  What a pleasant surprise this Little Saigon is. Nice openness - little rooms with big tables. The atmosphere was comfortable with a capital C - from seating, ordering, eating, to asking questions about the menu. I even felt comfortable being the typical annoying customer.   Our servers were very kind and pleasantly accommodating. They informed the vegetarians in our party of chicken stock in the soup broth. Did we care?   -- begin moment of silence -- ...thinking of the chickens who gave their lives. Uhhhh...a little animal flesh and blood never hurt nobody.   -- end moment of silence --  Soup! Soup! Soup! Soup!  Food was tasty and plentiful. We ordered a multitude of items like three appetizers, boba, fried rice, tofu, veggies, spinach and onions, and a curry dish. Here were my personal choices:  1. Deep fried vegetarian egg rolls ($6) - six small crispy rolls accompanied by romaine leaves, parsley, mint, slices of cucumber and carrot. The rolls have tofu inside. I found one cube of it in each roll that was easily picked out with chop sticks.  2. Lotus root salad ($7) - sans pork. Tasty marinated lotus root and veggies served with four crunchy shrimp flavored rice chips on the side. Lotus is easily identifiable by sight, but its taste blended with the other veggies. The texture of it though is also unique. It reminded me of bamboo slices that get served in chow mein.  3. Bok choy soup w/ginger and onions ($8) - served in large bowl. Very good broth, close to a quart with dark green bok choy and few pieces of ginger and onion. The veggies alone would not be filling, but if you drink all the broth, you'd be full for the next hour or so.  4. Eggplant with onions and veggies ($8) - ordered spicy. It was good, but was not as spicy as I hoped. Took home leftovers.  I definitely recommend this restaurant to any vegetarian looking to try Vietnamese food.

Lf27tGmmQlBhJ24RYS8Blw.text: This is a nice quite little restaurant. The people here are very courteous and friendly! The food is delicious!

hfkaghORvjkl3omp65N_Pw.text: Notice: This is a review for the Pho soup, none of the other dishes.   If you've been to other Pho places, the soup here tastes a little on the light side.  No matter though, it's still Pho, right?  I actually don't mind the lighter soup since it didn't make me feel as heavy/sleepy when walking out of the restaurant.  Aside from the on-the-light-side taste, the portions were good with plentiful amounts of beef, tripe, and tendon.  They also seem to serve chicken Pho here, too so if you want to avoid red meat you might want to try that out.    This place seems much more accommodating than other Pho places, most likely because the servers here actually know how to speak English.  For those who worry about poor service, you won't find that here.  These guys were on top of my water never being empty (a big one with Pho noodle soup, since it really seems to dehydrate you).  My dad also tried the Thai Boba Tea and said the boba was decent (I'm not a fan of Thai Tea, sorry!).    As for prices, they're a little on the steeper side of Pho at $9 for a combo soup, but as I mentioned above the portions are good so I would say it is worth it.

4UxqW_KxJp4MpJg5UoogPw.text: This is our favorite place to eat in Phoenix, we always stay over night  when We're passing through,  just so we can indulge our selves with the number 12 and the number 28 on the Little Saigon menu.

R0ga9hr-3sTjBije3s54Yw.text: Wecame here for lunch. We waited about 10 minutes to be sat at a table. Spring rolls were delicious. rq3b6B_NnLbDoTmj42PXHw.text: This little hole in the wall exceeded my expectations. So far every dish we had satisfied my taste buds except that some were a bit oily. The shrimp salad and the pho(sliced beef) were delicious. The crepe is a must try!

W-m1TcfKtX0VBSlgTMS2fg.text: Legit yummy! A friend and I met up for early lunch last Saturday and we loved the character and charm of the remade house, complete with potted plants and picket fence. As Yelpers suggested, I parked at the thrift store parking lot just north of the restaurant, but there's also street parking available on 57th Ave.  We showed up close to open because we were both starving and hate crowds. The inside was small, but I loved the nice touches like flowers on the table along with a full assortment of condiments, curtains on the windows, and fairly intimate setting.   I wasn't sure what to expect in terms of service after reading the below reviews, but it started off great - the waiter was friendly and offered to answer any questions we had. I had a Vietnamese coffee and my friend ordered a plain boba tea. Her tea was great, and my coffee was good, but not awesome. I enjoy watching the coffee sit and drip into the condensed milk myself and savoring that rich aroma, but here, they prepped the coffee in the back and just brought me the finished glass. It could have been a bit creamier, but it wasn't too sweet, and the coffee was delightfully strong.   We started with the shrimp and pork spring rolls (#2), which were a bit bigger (longer) than the ones I'd had in other restaurants, so they were sliced in half - $4 was fair for two of these bad boys. They were absolutely scrumptious and very fresh, but packed a little loosely, so the goodies kept falling out as I was trying to dip the roll. I'd recommend grabbing your spoon and scooping the peanut sauce as you need it. Also, try it with the red chile sauce on the table...yum.   We both had our hearts set on pho and ordered two bowls of sliced beef & shrimp pho, #12. The server remarked that it was his favorite menu item, so we were excited. The plate of goodies on the side did not disappoint, but we could have used some extra cilantro and basil. The flavor was just salty enough, the shrimp were more generously sized that I expected, and the beef was tender and not fatty or oily. I've noticed that some Vietnamese restaurants tend to add oil to their pho, and thankfully, Little Saigon did not. The bowl wasn't very greasy at all.  When we had gorged ourselves on delicious pho, we hung out for a few minutes and caught up. This is when I could see what other Yelpers had experienced in terms of service - as soon as the restaurant started to fill up, the servers became stressed and harried, checking tables with visible impatience. That's a bit ridiculous when you're making your way through a giant bowl of pho. I always tip extra if I stay a little longer, so I wasn't about to guilt myself into leaving. When we left a few minutes later, there was a grand total of two people waiting out in the foyer.   I also noticed that Little Saigon has a sizeable patio area out front with lots of potential, but a sign read "patio closed." If seating's an issue, guys, open up the patio. Shame too, it was a beautiful day. Unfortunately, indoors got a bit stuffy and warm, especially near our window seat. I even checked to see whether the window would open...lol.  Before tip, a boba tea, Vietnamese coffee, two spring rolls, and two bowls of delicious pho came to $30. Not bad for being stuffed out of our gourds.  Overall: solid Vietnamese cuisine, frankly the best (excluding homemade) I've had in the Valley. For you Vietnamese noobs, the menu details everything clearly and is organized by types of noodles - a must for gluten-free eaters (the rice noodles are great!). However, I'll be sure to get there during their non-peak hours to skip the attitude.

B6vbjd2sEtfUlpTdsLciwg.text: the food was very good I felt bad for the girls there were only two of them for 20 tables full and people want to be seated the beef pho was one of the best I have had in town the veggie spring roll was OK will be back soon

Came here for the first time 3 years ago with a Vietnamese friend who vouched for the place, I now bring my mom here every mother's day and on her birthday (we eat after our massage at Oasis down the street)! Love this place always a relaxing and beautiful place to come and eat ! Thank you !

GbNASTAKdd9mXR2KQWVt2Q.text: Number 37.... Awesome!  Quaint place, small but inviting.  Clean and funny listening to the employees yell at each other in Vietnamese.  Decent wine and beer selection. The egg roll  was perfect and the shrimp....wow.  I'll be ack VERY SOON!  Wanted to try the boba but no time, I was on lunch break.

Fyig_ez4RqhznH7vtNDbcQ.text: My top two Vietnamese food places to go to. The broth is A M A Z I N G as well as the egg rolls. They put taro in the egg rolls which I think gives it more flavor and a different texture. Worth the 20 minute drive from my house.

y2Ek1qjTgqjXycT1YNsNDA.text: Best vietnamese food EVER!  They make me feel like family when we visit.  Usually, I have one or two things I like at restaurants and stick with those, but everything on their menu is so good!  Gotta try it all.

jE-SqZI1ewJJqwJIBENueg.text: Definitely the best pho in the west side. To me the most important part of the pho is the broth - they have the most flavorful broth.  The only one that comes close is Pho Thanh in terms of flavor.  43rd Express is also very good.  Don't get me wrong, there are a lot of good pho places in Phoenix. dxuHNH-IIVJguHkW6dhY-Q.text: Well ended up at Little Saigon on Sat. night too and again great service and wonderful food. I noticed going to this place it almost feels like going to visit with family the staff is so nice and even the people that go in there have been really nice. It was packed saturday when we went and there were so many different types of people and I still felt that warm welcoming feeling. I really like this place a lot and so does my family. I wanted to go agin tonight but I didn't want them to think I was stalking the place lol. So if you are ever in the area check this place out it is the bomb!

tKQ3DhZX-NExksEsjMM-4Q.text: We went there one Sunday noon with a party of 20. I have to say, with the short staff that they had that day, they performed admirably. This is the 3rd time we've been there and they never fail us. We ordered different kinds of entrees from Bun Cha, Com Dia, Pho, and multiple orders of Cha Gio and Goi Cuon. My brother-in-law ordered the house fried rice for two young boys with us, and of course the adults had to try it first (to make sure it was good... lol). And, indeed it was. The kids also ordered a bunch of fresh coconut and they enjoyed it very much. When you go to a Vietnamese restaurant, don't just settle for the Pho. Try other things. This is the place to do it.

KWMHD2vSYsfDb1C9xj0PcA.text: Tried the #22 Mi Quang (egg noodle soup) and the #34 bun tom bo nurong (rice vermicelli salad bowl). The #34 was the bomb! Fresh and clean tasting, not heavy at all. The #22 just wasn't my thing, not to say it wouldn't be great for someone else. With so much on the menu we will be back to try everything.

Q-fjr5zQ4xwQtr8mjKawdA.text: Normally I love this place. The pho and egge rolls are so bomb. However today as I was eating I saw a cockroach on the wall. When I mentioned it to the waitress who was checking me out. It seemed normal. And thy charged me full price for our meal !!!!! Ewwwwwww seriously I just lost my appetite  to a roach and I had to pay full price. Never again

15XPaYELQJzUEbSyJogOgQ.text: Loved the atmosphere, loved the grilled chicken vermicelli salad.  Had lunch there a week ago Saturday and will definitely return on my next trip to Phoenix to try other dishes!

wtkUOTCb8-YsADaoCTknqQ.text: Where to even start...YUMMMMMMMY! My husband and I should have a frequent flyer card to Little Saigon we love it so much and could not feel more at home when we go there. John and his family have created the such hidden gem of Glendale in a refurbish home; filled with the aromas of a home cooked vietnamese meal as you walk in the front door.   We try to make it there at least once a week if possible...and we always ask John what to order (he's never steered us wrong)...and to this date we've NEVER had a bad meal....and thats at least 15-20 meals later.   Some of our favorites include the Potsickers (a must have starter), #27 which is a pan fried noodle with light brown sauce meats, chicken shrimp and veggies (AMAZING), the fried rice is out of bounds (and John's dad has now been making it a little spicier with basil...props to the master chef himself...he's outdone even his own masterpiece!). The ginger chicken it great as well as a sirloin dish with green onion (our new found favorite...with a side of 'coleslaw').   I can't say enough great things about Little Saigon....Oh and it's reasonably priced too! But you won't be disappointed!!!

Opf-sDfW9BjiSqJYqz7Z2Q.text: I am a Pho fan amongst soup fans. I eat Pho 3-4 times a month in SD and PHX. This is quality pho. #9 will do you solid. The staff is friendly. Good pho'ing!

rzkmguBTqWbJvI-p0lPM3g.text: Fo-yeah!! This place rocks! The first time we went there was based on Yelp reviews and we weren't disappointed. The egg rolls eaten wrapped in mint and cilantro and dipped in fish sauce simply blew us away. I'm yet to taste that kind of perfection anywhere else.  The second time we went, the service kind of put us off. The waiter brought us the wrong order and when we sent it back he made faces and ignored us the remainder of the meal, which we thought was very unprofessional.   My husband gives the 'Fo' 5 stars (a soup with noodles, meat and sprouts ) which is really high considering that he has eaten really great authentic Vietnamese food in Japan and HK. We love this place and will keep going back.

N-QfLrQvjbfyoNP3kaT-Cg.text: Awesome vermicelli and homemade potstickers! The vietnamese ice coffe delish and strong:) Tried their porkchop rice plate and their flashfried shrimp all very yummy!And prices very reasonable :-)

eZ6Bp8bx-WdEcK5ljrumVw.text: After staring at the pictures on here and being shut down the last time I tried to order out from the place I decided to go in person and give them a second chance.   We went on a Saturday night. Even though the place clearly says you have to be there by 8:30 to be seated, the sign on the door was already turned to the closed side and it was 8:07!!?? What is the deal with this place? I felt like just turning and walking away but the wife insisted on going in. The place was completely dead. Maybe 3 tables of customers and a group of relatives at another table. The inside is like you are in someones house that was converted to a restaurant. Nothing fancy and the walls need a really good scrubbing but for the most part it was relatively clean. The house is located on the northwest side of the street. Just south of a St Vincent De Paul building.   We were seated right away and ordered some spring rolls first. They were clear rolls and were stuffed with shrimp, beef, noodles, and some cilantro. There were two decent sized rolls and came with a peanut dipping sauce. They were tasty but I couldn't help but think they would be much better warm.   I ordered the 27 Pho ap Chao - pan fried noodle stir fry w/ beef, pork, chicken, shrimp, and veggies. It was piping hot and had a pretty decent flavor to it. It had a massive amount of vegetables. I am talking carrots, leaks, snow peas, etc. It could have used a little more meat but other than that it was very good. Then at the bottom of the dish I finally dug my way to the pan fried noodles. They were outstanding. Crunchy but soft. Burnt a little but not too much. They may have been the best part of the dish. My wife ordered some spicy chicken with vegetables. Her meal came with white rice and was huge as well. It tasted very similar to my dish but without the bomb noodles.   The server was very friendly and it seemed very much like a family ran business. The entire bill came out to under 30 bucks and could have fed two more people. I am very glad I gave this place a second and third chance. My only suggestion would be to either stop doing phone orders or provide the extra service and to not put your closed sign up when you are supposed to be open for almost another whole hour. If this place wasn't recommended from a friend I probably would have never gave it another chance.   To their defense they have a sign that states they do not take phone orders when they are busy. Maybe they should at the least put that on their answering machine so people don't keep trying to call back? That being said, their food is terrific, the portions are generous, and I can't wait to go back. Next time I will be sure to try and get there a little sooner.

W9NESbvBqlHv4OEcLRUUsg.text: My wife and I were looking to go eat some Thai food and searched Yelp for reviews. We spotted Little Saigon and it's great reviews. We have never had Vietnamese food before. We decided to give it a shot. The place is a cozy little house in Glendale. We were welcomed by the son of the owner and he greeted us like we were family. We were seated promptly and a great meal ensued! We especially like the veggie fried rolls app. Delicious! The curry chicken dish was good, but the cuts of chicken could've been better. We will be back and recommend you check this place out!

ijwHDkZq68oveQ6rDfFLlA.text: This place is okay.  Its cute and located kinda off the main street in downtown glendale.  Looked like a house turned into a restaurant so thats cool but the food was okay.  Ive had better but maybe its because im comparing it to CA.  Favorite here in Az, at least in phoenix area is still the one off of camelback and 17th believe.  The soup for the beef pho was not very good, too much oil and really not flavorful.  The rice dish was good but small portion.  My bf seemed to enjoy it.  Overall id eat there again if I really wanted pho and my usual spot isnt opened.

UF-q1THTufasxp1mDhdAGQ.text: My wife and I ate here because it kept coming up on our yelp apps. It was delicious!! Cathy, the owner's daughter was our waitress, and she set an excellent tone to the experience. Very vivacious, helpful , super friendly, and very quick, attentive service. I ordered a noodle salad with beef and shrimp, topped with their fish sauce. So good. My wife had the #37, a pork chop with shrimp, steamed rice topped with a fried egg, and an egg roll. She enjoyed it also. We will definitely be back!!

3oSwyByKxOMRT4lGuDFvJg.text: The food here was amazing.  We ordered it to go, It was ready when we got there, Came with extra sauces, Along with tons of additional produce.  Great service as well.  Overall a great place and delicious food.

Nuw0CYzw-ODUZTAieQbyeg.text: good food, service was friendly but a little slow in terms of getting a check and a box.  I did get the rice flour crepe, it was good but I have had better, this one was very thin outer layer of crepe and didn't have as much flavor as I have had at other restaurants.  I loved the Boba smoothie, was a little melted when it showed up but it was delicious.  I would give this place a second shot.

RCbVkZlOQf66FIm4UkIvOA.text: My second favorite vietnamese restaurant in the valley. Great pho, great atmosphere... spring rolls are to die for. Can't go wrong with this place, everything is good here!

N5LpXIhLR7n2mPui-_FgLg.text: So this is going to sound super cheesy but it's been a looong time since food had made me smile! I had the spicy chicken w/veggies in a lemongrass/fish sauce. (#51 on the menu). I took my first bite and instantly smiled... My daughter asked, "what's so funny" I responded with "nothing, this food is just that good that it made me happy". This was my first time here but def not my last!

DEzqu8Dz_D_DcmMkLqegjg.text: This place is AMAZING!!!!  We love the staff, the food, everything about it.  I wouldn't suggest getting take out here though.  They charge an additional fee for it.  Its not the cheapest place and I don't complain because everything I have eaten here is wonderful, but I do stop at the "to go" charge.  Its makes your meal quite spendy.   My favorites?  Vermicelli beef and shrimp salad and the Pho of course.  Their pork and shrimp spring rolls are to die for.  Best I have had so far at any Vietnamese place I have eaten at.

F3bbtDaYiJYn6ElV4XMDMA.text: First time trying Pho with my girlfriend and we picked the right spot... the location of this restaurant is very discreet but is truly a hidden gem... the food was phenomenal but what truly did it was the service. Min was super informative and took the time to answer any questions we had and explained all of the on table sauces. Our drinks were never empty and he checked on us frequently. Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Little macaroons ($1 each)

HW0tSOVKBSUPtwy3fG-Rlw.text: I had been wanting to Little Saigon for a very long time.  So glad I finally made it happen!  Wow!  It's now at the top of my list when I get to choose.  I'm going there for my Birthday!  The family that makes it happen is fantastic and the Pho is the absolute best around.  Everything on the menu is scrumptious, Spring Rolls are a must.  It's really difficult to get past the Pho to try the rest of the menu though!    Thank you Cathy and Caroline for answering all our questions and helping us decide.  It's really difficult to get our Vietnamese food anywhere else.

TeFDcygweMSB5T1y-u0TrA.text: Went for the first time yesterday, got #38. Food was  very good and tasty. Service was great. We will definitely go back soon.

TIvDPM-x_B7at1tnpLWC9w.text: This place is a small place but the food is really good. But most of the time they are busy and the parking is bad especially if there's alot of people.   The food is really good especially the fried rice and the soup was really yummy as well. I would recommend people to come here even just to try if you love vitnames food this is the 1 place I would go and try if you are in the glendale area and the souranding is really nice if you like to walk around after you eat because for sure your going to be very full so a walk is needed which a plus because this place has a great place to walk around.  I recommend you also try there desert. Most of the time I come here I always try to make room for the desert. It's really good and it just melts into your mouth.

j74t8xsjY4wdOuKRfD2STA.text: My wife and I have to travel over 40 minutes to eat here and we've been here a dozen times. We often take out of town visitors and customers here, like we did tonight.   To start, the server forgot one of our five drinks. One meal was missing a meat. The most annoying thing about our last visit was that they forgot to make my wife's meal and started cooking it after the rest of us had nearly finished our meal, and every other table (seated after us) was served. When the meal finally arrived, everyone else had finished so we asked for the meal to go expecting it to be free because it came out ridiculously late and was clearly forgotten. Instead of an apology we were told that if we wanted the meal we had to pay for it despite it being forgotten and arriving after everyone else had finished.   The service was just bad. Not once did anyone apologize for any of the forgotten items and to argue over a $9 meal with customers who come often and with guests just seems petty. We'll take our guests to one of the many other Vietnamese establishments in the valley from now on.    Go somewhere else

_auRaGNk3Mys8vDwWYLlog.text: Great pho and spring rolls! Always great service and very reasonably priced! Hands down this is my favorite place to eat pho and spring rolls. Also, they are very quick to bring out the food!!

C5nHKSYBkrLj_FnSw-E94g.text: This Vietnamese Restaurant is located in Old Town Glendale with all the cute shops. The atmosphere is really charming because this restaurant is a very old tiny cute converted house. This time I ordered the large chicken salad. I received a really big mound of fresh crispy cabbage mixed with light as air iceberg lettuce. My salad was laced with fresh herbs and white meat chicken and a fresh light limey dressing. It's a perfect meal for when your running around and it's hot outside. I thought the small salad would be too small but the large is more than I can eat. So small salad and and an appetizer or dessert is the way to go.  My husband had a pork and rice plate. It was very good and came with a fried egg and a crispy pork filled roll.   I wanted to try a macaron but our server got busy and slapped our check on the table while we were eating.   So we paid and left.

fufhe4sfV_dJobQUGmlagQ.text: We've been here a couple of times and we never really had issues and plus we did come later in the evening, maybe the workers were tired. We sign and get seated in 4 mins, we get out drinks and start ordering. We ordered pho and egg rolls. Takes awhile to get the food, we finally get it. The nuc mam is watered down, and to our luck my bf gets a hair in the food. He was cool about it, didn't make a scene and it takes about 15 mins to be noticed by a waiter, he sends back the pho with the hair. It takes another 20 mins to the pho back. The pho has less meat and broth. At the end we ended up paying for everything or didn't get an apology or discount since the pho did have hair

QIvZY0FneT0TuOy4QXaAhg.text: The GF girl says: So I had the number 8 pho ( rice noodle with meatball) which is what I usually get at other places. I've never had meatballs that tasted like the ones at Little Saigon. They were crunchier than usual and didn't taste very appealing. They tasted like they had been frozen or bought premade. Otherwise, the soup broth and noodles were excellent.  The GF girl parent says: I had the rice paper roll appetizer with rice vermicelli shrimp, cilantro, and pork. With peanut dipping sauce-delicious. And filling.  Service was excellent.

jwkqilAc7A_QvQ4tJhoCBQ.text: Been coming here for YEARS! Never disappointed. I usually stick to the items I know and like best.

Nt5F5-x2-sLDy5csDORpCg.text: lemongrass chicken in sizzling pot -  a total variation of lemongrass chicken  that i've never tried before.   it came in a sauce that was pretty thin, like soup  but was SO flavorful and spicy.   it was perfect to mix with rice.   a solid 5/5 and my absolute favorite thing here  catfish dish (1st on the seafood item list) -  sweet, slightly spicy, the sauce was almost like a glaze also fantastic just .00000000001 behind the lemongrass chicken

TUeXiGJSYrMeT0qC2aGc3w.text: Its sadly a one star rating. Been coming for years but haven't been back in at least 8 months. Im giving this rating in hopes that they make changes.   First, very dirty and cluttered.   The outside area has seats but has never allowed seating because they are too lazy to clean it.   Bathroom looks like your 75 yr old aunties house..you know the one..and soap is watered down to literally water.  Needs a major update and cleaning.   I ordered the pho soup, as I always have. Meat was very rough and not fresh. The meatballs had a strange taste and the broth tasted light like water.   Hope the place improves.

aEv9c2xUafEZ11Ibbbc9uA.text: Great food, great location!, was timely and good! Why does yelp make me write so much

K2jCE_xVPcOtMEDqhmv9Kw.text: We drive 22 miles from Goodyear to enjoy the food and service here.  This is the best. Great Vietnamese food at a fantastic value. Staff is so warm and welcoming. Great find.

7mOhkrDO00NeIFgOTnifNQ.text: This restaurant is definitely a fun place to visit and the old timey Glendale house that they have here is both enjoyable and relaxing inside. It can be a little hard to find so bring your GPS or cell phone.  Came here with my new Yelp friend Michael C for a mini UYE. We were trying to find a new place with some spicy kick and decided to give this place a test drive.  Ordered some Veggie Spring Rolls and some Catfish Soup. Mr Mike went with a Spicy Chicken and Noodle dish and had them make it extra spicy. They also have plenty of nifty condiments to jazz things up a bit on the table.  Both the food and the service were outstanding and the prices were very reasonable. Their menu has a good variety of Vietnamese favorites and you can have them customize the ingredients if there are certain foods that you should not be eating.  Looking forward to bringing my wife here and treating her to a nice comfortable meal. The cool part is afterwards you can go for a swell walkabout around the downtown area and visit some of their really old town and classic shops as well as just soaking up some scenery. I'LL BE BACK!  4.5 STARS

ftMWu7bIZX675H7P5RTvuw.text: My first time exploring a new Vietnamese restaurant in AZ. I ordered the special dry noodles and a friend order Pho special. My noodles came out looking very greasy due to how it was prepared. Very much Chinese food style, the broth is not hot enough, green onions is stale, the broth lack of flavor from the slow cook of the bone, same for the pho. It's a family operation and home atmosphere. The food is not as authentic as I like it to be. The flavor is gear towards non traditional Vietnamese food.  Overall, service is great, ambient is good, food is ok to my expectations for authentic Vietnamese. I would not comeback or recommend to friends if they love authentic Vietnamese food. It's average food to my personal opinion.  Enjoy
