DyBHu2cL3dFC8OWsHmTUeA.text: My friends have been raving about thus place for months. We finally made it out here to try it. The place was packed for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon. Good sign. We waited for about 15 minutes for a table.  Feels like a large house turned into a restaurant. We were seated in s smaller room to the side. Only 2 servers working together. Both were hostesses and cashier and everything else st the same time. One took our drink order and ran off. Before drinks came the other server came over to take the order. Very rushy (is that a word)? I knew what I wanted from the awesome Yelper pics. So I explained to her that I was highly allergic to shellfish. Usually, actually, ALWAYS, when I mention the allergies, the servers go out of their way to make me feel welcomed. Always accommodate my needs and triple reassurance that my meal will be prepared and cooked separately and without contamination to any seafood. The server with a smirky and "not my problem " attitude told me that everything was prepared and marinated with fish sauce and contaminated with seafood while under preparation. Which I thought food preparation had to be separated. However, she then went on to tell me if u get hives I can't help u. If u need an epipen I can't help you. Her attitude was enough for my hubby and I to say thank you but we'll pass. And left to eat at a friendlier more accommodating Asian restaurant. Actually made me sad because the food looked so good but I'm not going to put my health in danger. And I will not let my allergies become a joke to unprofessional ppl. Had a nice lunch elsewhere.

LTT4zvgR6Ea4PQ8ZTqZxOA.text: Dear gods I love this place. I am sitting here right now writing this review daydreaming about the spring rolls.  As for the pho, I have heard from many reliable sources how delicious it is. I put too much cilantro in mine the first time, but even so it was pretty good. Just uh...make sure you go with someone that knows how to eat pho, because I did not and that's why I messed up. Make sure to put the meat, bean sprouts, and noodles in first. Everything else is up to your own liking.   Now this place is a 40 minute drive for me during rush hour, which should show my devotion. The staff were friendly, the food was ready when I got there. Just be prepared for there to be a lot of old asshole customers. You know the kind. Snow birds. But if you tell them to fuck off, you'll have evening entertainment too.   Now excuse me while I go daydream about the spring rolls more.

B9-e3YHSyZtRgv5ZLXCJEw.text: This place rocks!  Well worth a short drive off I-17 to enjoy some of the best Pho in the Valley!  I've had the Pho, shrimp springrolls (outstanding) and their Kung Pow-savored every morsel.  Service from the owners is wonderful, I love it when a business "gets it" and this place is hitting on all cylinders.

I878t0ZCKtTwv8ZubiBSDg.text: We went to Little Saigon a few months ago, with the expectation that this is gonna be one of the few places with great Vietnamese food we can fall back on when we crave it due to all the great reviews on Yelp. However, just like another one in Cave Creek, it blew away my expectations, and not in a good way. I dunno what it is, but maybe since I'm Asian and I go to Vietnamese restaurants you can give us crap food and crap service? Hell, I don't even care about the service, all I really care about is the food.  Service - ok. barely. nobody bothered to refill our drinks, even though we were right outside the kitchen, with NOBODY else there dining at the time. The girl took forever to come take our order, messed up our order, and had trouble with the credit card machine afterwards as well. Damn. If you were new (don't know for sure) at least let us know what to expect.  Food: We ordered spring rolls, chicken pho, cold noodles, and the infamous #55 spare ribs that many people raved about via quick tips at the time.  Spring rolls: Ok, but the peanut sauce tasted like...well...let's just say water would've had more flavor. How can you mess up peanut sauce?  Pho: not bad, but nothing great to write home about.  Cold noodles: see above   infamous #55 spare ribs: Well, I don't really know. When we got this thing in a clay pot, we opened it, and there were pieces of fish. We were like WTF? We asked the waitress, to which she replied, yes, that's #55. We asked if #55 was fish, and not spare ribs, to which the waitress replied yes. She then goes back into the kitchen, and moments later, the cook comes out, asks us if we wanted spare ribs, which we confirmed. He then said he would cook us the spare ribs, and took away the clay pot full of fish. It wouldn't have been so bad if the spare ribs were amazing, but what came back was a few lumps of meat on bone that was submerged in black pepper. Of course, there were no apologies. If you go to their website and look at their menu, #55 is clearly NOT fish.  After we finished what barely passed as dinner, we got our bill, and gave our dedit card to the waitress. She seemed to have a lot of trouble with the credit card machine, and apparently entered in the wrong amount the first time, so she had to do a refund and start a new transaction. Normally, not a big deal. However, she was fumbling around, not saying anything, then going in and out the kitchen with our debit card, then finally someone showed her what to do. In the meantime, we were starting to wonder if they had taken down our debit card number, and if our checking account was going to be wiped out by the time we got home (did not, thank god).   Needless to say, we won't be back...

GsljkMwx_TvJapyyKqxxtg.text: One of the best Pho spots I've been to here in Phoenix! Potstickers were on point as well!!

PKYWd3428uXfWQCiFbhCVA.text: Staff is always friendly when we go! My favorite place in Arizona to go get pho! It brings back childhood memories. Their pho is very spot on and I love everything about this little place.

9j4l5LkGl0Cixv1w1W-s1g.text: *DISCLAIMER* Awful and unapologetic service! Though many reviews offered high marks for this restaurant's food, in my book, the thing that sets the tone of the restaurant is its service. When we (3) first entered the restaurant, no one greeted us and there was a party of 10 and 2 in front us. Many people showed up after us, so it seemed that the restaurant was popular. After 25 minutes, the party of 2 left while the party before us waited an hour before they were seated. And yet even after they had just been seated, a party member had to grab the menus themselves from the front because of the lack of service. If a restaurant receives as many high reviews, then high quality service has to be accompanied with it. I don't care if the food supposedly tastes good. If the servers don't even apologize, let alone acknowledge you, why bother?

xTCgX8ijimSpXblm41-z_w.text: Best Vietnamese food in the valley!!! The waitress is so sweet and will remember you. Food is flawless, average price for Vietnamese food, not too pricey, cozy atmosphere, quick and hot. Definitely a regular now.

Y0B53kZDoVGpSrvH3ghzDw.text: The food here is just great. The pho and eggrolls are the best I have tasted. The only problem is the service. I've had one of the young guys twice already, and he has chosen other people before myself and family. Maybe he's bias, but how is he going to take the order of some else who was there after us. When we told him we were there first he, he still brought their good first. I'm sorry I'm not white, but this discrimination is ridiculous. Trust me we are not difficult people and we tip really well.

_cLEtA_nWQZ7JGaVQLJPOQ.text: Best Vietnamese in the area hands down!!! Pork spring rolls and potstickers were delicious!!! Fantastic, attentive service!! Amazing salad bowls!! Can't wait to go back!!

L5_UtNc2IdZP4HV1hCsnqw.text: What's not to love about this place?  The veggies are so crisp and delicious, they make me want to find the source and buy some for home.  I'm not going to pretend to be an expert in the cuisine but everything I've tried here is absolutely delicious and I can't pronounce any of it.   The outside of the restaurant is adorable and kind of romantic and the inside is unassuming and seemingly clean.  I think it's very reasonably priced for such fresh and flavorful food.

2yK7-xZaKLJPBdj8W5y_0Q.text: Service was quick and attentive and the food was good. Not as good as the other place we used to eat Pho at but was OK. Our old place, Central King Eggroll in Goodyear, switched owners and isn't nearly as good as it once was and we're trying to find a new place. Little Saigon was good but not great and the Pho was super greasy which isn't what we're used to.  I would eat here again if I were in the area but won't drive all the way from Goodyear to eat here.

0ZOB-ErqcTAu0wKKUxPh9w.text: Very good, very fresh!! Was my first visit got pot stickers and beef and shrimp vermicelli, was delicious!!!

4TA344BIXhuUE2A4bhvwkg.text: I love little Saigon. Super clean, super friendly, great service and the food is delicious and cheap.   The pot stickers are stuffed to the seam with shredded (not minced) pork and are seared and steamed perfectly.  I usually go for the Pho but will switch up for the beef and shrimp rice vermicelli every other visit. I always want Pho tho.  I've never left disappointed. I think I'm a regular now.  Another nice to know is that most of the cafes, restaurants and coffee shops have their own mini version (not as artsy and far from crowded) of First Friday activity. Little Saigon sits in the hub (if you will) of all things cool in DT Glendale. Alley way karaoke seems to be a common attraction. Most of the boutiques and antique shops do close up early so the most you will get is some interesting window shopping.  Fill yer flask, take a stroll.

JEAKGknRRrOV6RGQEGN-bw.text: Took my oldest friend here  today for lunch, and got him hooked. He's lucky since he just lives about 2 blocks from this place. He had 2 pork chops shrimp with an over easy egg, a salad, and a side of veggies. I had the #64 beef and shrimp with veggies in a brown sauce. It was delicious, and just the right size for lunch. My friend took home a nice snack for later. This place will is worth the time for lunch, but get there early because it's small, and it fills up fast.

vwtTpKjLTT2TPXzXvg34cg.text: Love love love! Every time to drive up to the valley we always make sure to stop by and get some great food here. Love #25! Great small little place in downtown glendale. Thing I love the most on how it's tucked away from the street, it almost feels like you your pulling up to your own private hidden place.

uLAoTSecDqpOFZfEDtgPbQ.text: Great locally owned authentic restaurant. I love every dish I have tried. Chicken pho, the chicken curry pot, the eggplant vegetarian meal, and so many other dishes. Don't forget to order the fried bananas as an appetizer! Yummy! And they still have the best peanut sauce I have ever tasted at any Vietnamese/pho kitchen. If you like pacing your appetizer and meal make sure to order your appetizer and do not order your meal til you are almost finished with the appetizer. This restaurant does not do very well with timing of meals mostly because it is a small restaurant and they need to get people in and out in order to accommodate everyone. That being said, if they are busy this is not a place to hang out and hog a table for hours. Enjoy a great Vietnamese meal and then enjoy down town Glendale if you want to visit with your friends.

QEru0GBrxkpbf2-Ur5Tpog.text: Yum! What a surprise to find a little place this good in the Phoenix area. The vermicelli was light and fresh, the curry tasty and slightly spicy, and the Vietnamese coffee just the right amount of sweet. The service was attentive and prompt, and the setting delightful! What more could one ask?

NqZWp3fBkvIx0-gpvsXaHw.text: Just moved here from San Diego and wanted to find a great place to grab pho and I have found it!!! Great place at a great price.

pzphb1HmHzkeE064TivKrw.text: Delicious gem in the west valley. Portions are small but they are reasonable prices so I just kept ordering more

baWXRuBCSKHQhkvmYGjcQQ.text: Man, I love this place.   I usually end up with #23, I don't know how to say it in Vietnamese, but it's damn good. My wife usually gets a #22, which is apparently a very, very, authentic dish. I am told you can only get it in certain areas of Vietnam, it is also delicious.   Spring rolls, best anywhere, I have yet to find a better spring roll from the 20-or-so other Pho places I've been to.  #47 for those of you who like Steak and rice dishes.

tiekrQZqBcDi1KbG2kCLzw.text: I've been coming to Little Saigon for almost 20 years. In that time I have experienced several other Vietnamese restaurants in the valley, but consider only one the best - Little Saigon.  The place: A family run business located in a quaint, converted house that has a great vibe. Lots of warm feeling wood and decorated with traditional Vietnamese art and items. This is the only Vietnamese restaurant I have been to that cares about it's appearance as much as the food. The bathrooms are very nice and clean. Other Viet restaurants are usually found in strip malls, having all the ambience of going to the DMV.   The staff: Always friendly and attentive, especially John and his wife. John's dad is usually in the kitchen making the fantastic food that has kept me going back for years. If you ever need guidance through the extensive menu or need help on what to order, John will hook you up.  The food: Now let's talk about the best part of Little Saigon, the food. From the Pho to the Bun and clay pots, Little Saigon has it where it counts.  Fresh herbs and vegetables (nothing canned) and tender meats make it a great experience.  My personal favorite are the Bun bowls (Rice noodle salad).  The meats are marinated and gilled, having lots of flavor.  Noodles are done to perfection and the lettuce greens and herbs are always fresh.  The Pho (soups) are the perfect thing for a cool day and even in the summer. Flavorful broth with noodles, beef slices or meatballs (yes, meatballs) and more of those great herbs like mint and cilantro. Yum!  My wife is a fan of the clay pots for the slightly more intense flavors found with these meals. I enjoy them as well.  The beer I prefer to drink with my meals is the Vietnamese "33 Export" they serve. Similar to Tsing Tao, but seems to have a little more kick, ;)  If you are trying Vietnamese food for the fist time, I highly recommend Little Saigon.   You won't be disappointed and probably will get hooked like I did years ago.

No5sok5zKkXyVrZX-S4KDQ.text: Great veitnamese food! Obviously they have some great pho but the spring rolls and vermicelli always hit the spot!

JnWT0CbIKCX_LHb_mp8SMg.text: Possibly the best Vietnamese in the valley, and definitely my favorite west of I-17.  Charming little place in a small house, right in the middle of downtown Glendale.  I've been here a few times and never had a bad dish.  Usually I go with pho or a noodle dish, but this time we branched out.   I got the #37 pork tenderloin with shrimp and egg - a delicious, thin marinated pork chop that was simple yet satisfying.  My wife got #56, which is a spare rib with a sweet and salty sauce, baked and served in a clay pot.  The dish is very flavorful and probably best shared between two people while paired with a less savory second dish to even out the palate.  I see a few complaints about the service - it's never been a problem for me, though they did recently stop taking Amex cards so no luck burning my recently received gift card...

bRlg440Jm2yAfzwYzDYmMQ.text: I have made an effort to try different things each time i go here and i love it all! The food is always amazing and the atmosphere is just great. Nice and attentive staff!

Tpe3h_1GmZvylMejx36EXA.text: I ordered to go around 11 am and definitely the food wasn't fresh at all. On top of that I found a strand of hair. It makes me lose my appetite. I guess I won't be return here again. I give 4 star for the Mixed veggies that taste pretty good and 1 star for the Pho Dac Biet ( it tastes awful).

x7VCOJdoNd9swqE5Yod8ow.text: Never disappoints.. Today I had a work lunch and ordered the appetizer #2 Goi Cuon.. (Grilled pork, shrimp, and vegetable spring rolls) a Vietnamese iced coffee, and for my entree I can haz #39 Com Dac Biet So 2 (grilled pork tenderloin and beef with fried vegetable rice) instead of the eggroll I asked for a fried egg.. It was all amazing. And the selection of condiments such as hoisin, sriracha, and chili paste can make it even more flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. BBrain special :)

bnPmfl_JJCNoI--P7TGmLw.text: Boo! Went with a big birthday group after confirming business hours. Got their well over 30 mins before their posted closing business time. Told us kitchen was already closed and turned us away! I would understand if it was a bar/sportsbar where they have last calls for kitchen food and a bar to operate later than their kitchen. If a restaurant has certain hours, I was always under the impression the kitchen is open until the closing time.  May take a while for me to want to come back here. Even tried to plead our case and it was a no go as the host sat there counting his money. Wow.

MPWi12JB6Pzj9InIVKTLsA.text: Had high hopes from reviews. Place was literally the inside of someones house. Server seemed prejudiced because she brought our drinks out and never came back. Another server did the rest. And they would check on every table a lot except ours, because they probably thought white ppl tipped better. I ordered calamari and it was a bit burnt at parts meaning black. It was bland. I barely ate any and just drank soup from what my SO ordered. Servers obviously noticed I barely ate, not once did they ask "is something wrong? Did you want something else?" They just handed me the check and I spoke up saying I didn't like it because it tasted burnt and bland to me to which the server responded, "it's not burnt. It's like that because at stirfried." Like yeah.... I know what burnt is. I've had deep fried food that was stir fried before and it didn't have black marks on it and taste bitter.. and he's like you can talk to the manager. Like I've worked in restaurants as a server when I was younger and whenever I notice someone not enjoying their food I would ask about it and let the manager know they don't like it not just tell them to talk to the manager about it. So at this time I was upset I'm just like yeah whatever. The guy just walked away without getting the manager or anything. I had to walk up to the cash register to pay. He didn't say anything. All I got was "sign here." I usually tip at least 20% on every meal and this is my first time not tipping. Customer service was horrible. I didn't even eat the food and just left it. Customer service and satisfaction should be their first priority rather than defending it and trying to make someone pay for something they don't like. So cheap! Felt so prejudiced against and then almost forced to pay for shitty service and a shitty meal. Go somewhere else for viet food.

AT55lTL9nkPvdpZD3vrnGA.text: This was our first time Having Vietnamese food and it was very good. We had potstickers as an appetizer and two different kinds of pho. Our bill was less than 20 dollars. Great value. The restaurant looks to be a converted house, so you're eating very close to the other guests and felt like you had to talk quietly. I will go back.

_xJ-4b4hsUnWWFMRBmEiXw.text: Boyfriend took me here as his favorite place. Absolutely loved the pho I had and definitely will be coming back again to try some other stuff.

UI_ntS75yJLVY26uCBhuzA.text: Was excited to try this location after reading all the fabulous reviews...but the food and service was subpar. Not to mention the Mr.'s stomach did not favor the curry :( sadly won't be returning. Really wanted to like it, but just couldn't! Still on the hunt for good, authentic Vietnamese!

lAHIjtAfFd2joqdYsx7wLw.text: Go to Quan Hy in LA, CA and your opinion on the food here might change. To me, food was okay.

Cgb98iNsqunwoeVzRTD-tw.text: First, let me start by saying the five star rating is relative. This is the best place I have found in the valley to get my Vietnamese food fix. I'm not talking the usual pho or spring rolls, I'm talking some real, hard to find, authentic Vietnamese dishes that pho restaurants don't make/serve. Compared to some of the best places I've been for Vietnamese food (including Vietnam), it wouldn't be 5 stars, but for the valley? Definitely.   They have a fairly wide selection of dishes and everything that I have tried has been well made and tastes great. My boyfriend and I usually order #65 (steamed catfish in a hot clay pot), #72 (flash fried calamari), and my favorite #88 (sweet and sour catfish soup). I love that we can get full, but it's still a light full, not heavy and greasy. Nothing like some fresh Vietnamese food to get you feeling right!

mtsJESQqDlieRPZRkZdSHQ.text: Favorite! We love it. Order from them at least once a month. They are always busy so try not to go at lunch time. We love the pot stickers, spring rolls and Beef Pho.

OiD9T9BS-z6rubhi7A5zsg.text: Excellent food at a low price. Finally, a Vietnamese restaurant where the Asian staff speaks English. You can ask a question, and get an answer without a puzzled look, pause, and a smile. A perfect place to expand your experience with Vietnamese food beyond pho.

313HQrZT1Qt_JjoVplFLpg.text: Have been here several times in the past two years or so - always great food and outstanding service.  Servers really know their stuff and are always eager to recommend the best dishes.  Menu is very extensive.  Everything is very fresh and flavorful.  The location is a (somewhat) renovated old cottage in old-town Glendale, just one short block north of Glendale Ave.  One larger dining room and three or four smaller rooms.  Everyone takes great pains to make sure you are happy.  If you are a fan or Vietnamese food or you are anxious to try it for the first time, I highly recommend Little Saigon.

g4748vO1x_eufM-Wz2-ucw.text: Wonderful neighborhood spot. The food was superb and service excellent. We enjoyed a grilled chicken vermicelli salad, stir fried vegetables, pork ribs and onions, and a make-your-own spring roll meal (#79). If I lived nearby I'd be here all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Our friendly and helpful serving providing instructions on the wrap-your-own meal.

p-9TAFfC1t7VB4xp_MrnCg.text: Very romantic little restaurant in Glendale near all the downtown shopping. They have good food and great service. The menu has a wide selection with vegetarian options. There is outdoor seating, too! Great place, I'm a regular here.

MTlS8jVRgKLZbyWvOILiLQ.text: This place is an amazing hidden gem I am so happy to find good pho and cold noodles out here I will definitely keep coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Vermicelli bowl with beef and shrimp so good
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Sliced beef and meatball pho

GKRL477L3oFrbLqNjpxVtQ.text: I have been to the restaurant once . Its a family owned restaurant located in downtown Gledale. My experience has been good. The food is quite awesome.  Food: 4 out of 5 Ambience: 2 out of 5 Service: 3 out of 5

0_s4vmPbKQif8JhGSKeKww.text: Mmmhmmm this place rocks!  The service is outstanding and it's located in a sweet little spot downtown Glendale.  The prices and hours are a bonus and they do serve great unique drinks,  na and alcoholic

FXsa737BVZ1hqYDJAuQrcA.text: Everything is delish! Spring rolls are the best in town. Tom Garlic Shrimp is second to none. Sometimes they don't answer their phone to take phone/pick-up orders but don't be discouraged, the trip in for the food you get, is worth it!

Igb554JF1zrowiH_e6fEpQ.text: Cute little Vietnamese restaurant in downtown Glendale. The food was good/decent. I liked my bun. The pork was flavorful.   The portions were nice. My egg rolls and the snow was ok. I probably wouldn't get next time just because it's not as good as others that I've had. But I'd definitely come back to try more things!  It is a bit pricier than other Viet restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Pork Bun. Egg rolls. Taro snow.

Xip7clos95i9BvZHmJ77SQ.text: I wasn't sure what to get, but the hostess helped me out. The veggie fried spring rolls are to die for and the 23, 51, & 54 were oh so very good as well. Everything seemed fresh. Will be going back

x0nXbOziIF3DtM9RmHrpZA.text: Came in for the 2nd time today. The 1st time with such a great experience. The 2nd time the hostess was completely rude when I asked if we could be seated because they had empty tables. She looked at me it with a disgusted face and said we still have to feed people you're gonna have to wait 15 to 20 minutes. When I let her know I was going to put this on Yelp she said go ahead I don't care about Yelp. Will never be back to spend any of my money here

uC8XrUdZTcbGC8qJkj9jqg.text: So amazing always has great service food is to die for a family favorite 100% would recommend to anyone with a live for ph'o

2f1htj-XjxBA3jipv5hAPQ.text: This hidden gem is tucked away in the heart of downtown Glendale. Little Saigon is a very small restaurant and does not seat too many patrons at one time. When we went in, there was a couple leaving and we got their table, the last table available. There were only a couple of people working in the restaurant, but they were very efficient in getting drink & food orders, answering any questions, etc.  After a glance over the menu, I knew I was in the mood for some fried rice so I decided to get a grilled chicken plate and substituted for fried rice. My date got the most filling pho soup per recommendation from our waiter. I'm not a huge fan of pho, but my boyfriend really enjoyed it. He said he'd definitely recommend it since it was flavorful and had a lot of meat; like our waiter said, it was very filling. As far as the rice dish goes - my only complaint about the chicken is that it was a very fatty piece. The fried rice however was really good. When we go next, I'd ask if I can get just the fried rice because it was the best thing on the plate, along with an order of the egg rolls. I might try one of the stir-fry noodle dishes as well.  The food & service was good, so we'll be back here in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Pho ... close up.
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Pho.
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Grilled Chicken with Fried Rice.

US_8ceU72zRwtA7ceJsWtg.text: This place was the gem that bonded my sister and her husband as they dated through college. It is high quality, low cost and intimate. Get the #36 and spring rolls. Seriously.

s337dVStpVMDlbevGwXMFw.text: Love this place, a great little find in downtown Glendale. Great food, service and prices!

AoTJV7dNNeDRmdp9T6xQRw.text: Awesome Vietnamese in downtown Glendale. Normally when we go here it's for spring rolls and Banh Xep (rice flour crepe with shrimp pork and bean sprouts )always, sometimes pho and sometimes one of their delicious vermicelli salad bowls with chicken or pork. They always have fresh fixings with everything like mint, basil, cilantro and the jalapenos (with the pho)for all the dishes we get. Pho is huge and hot as hell and we are sweating and full when done. Everything has so many different flavors and textures and I love the variety. Employees are always pleasant and attentive to our needs and have made special requests(for kids because no kids menu) when needed. If you like bobas try the Thai one! YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States

qcCQK5YTXDdrzZh_OMhUKw.text: My second try with Pho. I love it!  I had the beef and meatball. The broth was hot and flavorful. With a little hoisin and some soy sauce added took it up to the next level. I dropped in a good handful of fresh bean sprouts. My only thing I would say I put some whole cilantro and mistakenly thought I could chew it and swallow. Next time I will strip the leaves. The stem got stuck in my mouth. One meatball had a large piece of grizzle but the meatball itself was finely ground with great spices. Those little things didn't bother me. The price is right. This little place you could almost miss when driving on 57th Avenue is super clean and has very efficient and friendly staff.  I will definitely try not again on one of their other dishes.

Uu7R8e6VgYnUpA_m_7vHjw.text: My husband, sister, and I had a most delicious lunch starting with the pot stickers (really yummy) then on to lunch. I had the #26 Semi-crispy flat rice noodles with beef, chicken, pork and mixed veggies (super yummy), husband had #24 egg noodles with beef, pork, chicken and veggies (good, but could have used a little more spices), sis had #28 rice vermicelli with grilled pork (the pork could have been a little more grilled to carmelize the meat, but yummy nonetheless). We were too full to have dessert but maybe next time, because there will certainly be a next time.

hmmTV_eKArbk3SYLlHMOeQ.text: Found a hair in our food. Felt rushed to order arrived at 8:01PM server told us we needed to place our order because the kitchen would be closing at 8:15 PM. Food was not as good as I was hoping for very disappointed expected more since they have such great reviews

7QO-U6HLeb-g59hp-MZeDw.text: Ordered chicken and veggie pho with 2 orders of egg rolls to go and was delicious. Very nice place with friendly service.

DWN0fXUSYUikL_Ha7iVAWw.text: I found my new favorite Vietnamese spot.  Its cute, quaint and located in historic downtown Glendale.  Lots of businesses located in downtown Glendale are in charming historic homes.  The front patio had several plants and vines on the white picket fence gave the a feel of entering a secret garden.  Once your inside you can tell this was a home at one point, wood floors throughout.   The hostess has you sign in.   After a short wait we were taken to our table.  Our drink orders were immediately taken.  I got some hot jasmine tea and lemonade and my daughter cold jasmine iced tea.  My hot tea was brought out in a cute porcelean tea pot and tea cup.    We then placed our food orders.  We got veggie egg rolls, chicken fried rice and rice noodles with chicken and veggies.  The egg rolls came out first and oh my holy egg rolls were they good.  Fresh lettuce, cilantro, cucumber, basil and jicama to roll up your egg roll and then sweet fish sauce to dip.  Soo good.  Fried rice tasted like actually fried rice.  The noodle stir fry was also amazing.   This is a nice little hideaway to sneak away and enjoy great food.  After you eat you can also enjoy all the antique shops in Downtown Glendale.  Perfect Sunday date with my daughter!

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Rice noodles, chicken and veggies stir fry.
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Chicken fried rice.
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Veggie eggrolls with fresh lettuce, cilantro, cucumber, jicama and basil with sweet fish sauce.

1OeM45rn-4Nl3lcc8feLcg.text: So so so good! Super fresh ingredients, high quality, perfectly seasoned. I ordered stir fry, the boyfriend ordered Pho and said it was the best he's ever had, ever! Will for sure be back.

HrlVVZG1Wuov4oDOGGNDpQ.text: I've been here maybe twice, both times the service was ok but I went here last night with my mom and a friend and it took 20 minutes for a worker to even acknowledge that we were waiting to be seated. Now I understand being busy and not being able to seat us right away. But at least acknowledge that you see me and let me know with a hand gesture that you'll be over as soon as you can.  Now when we finally sat at our table in the front room where the register Is at...not like we were in the back and can easily be forgotten.  No one came over to ask what we would like to drink or to say hey I'm sorry for the wait we are short handed tonight and petty busy etc. We start to look around the room and the two other groups that were there only had their drinks and seam to have been waiting awhile already for their food. Another 15 minutes went by and still no one has come to take our order. So we wait about 5-6 more minutes. We were hungry and not wanting to wait any longer so we left. Again i completely understand being busy but all they had to do was acknowledge that we were waiting and let us know the wait for food will be longer than normal. All I can say is I won't be going back. And it's such a shame cause it's close to home and the food is pretty good but horrible customer service is a deal breaker for me.

YKzFxgm0Es1NmLouITnyow.text: Tip: This place is on 57th Avenue, as the address shows. You're driving and starving and you see 58th Ave and you think, "Yay, 57th is next!" Well, it IS, but it's 57th DRIVE. Ya gots to go one more block to 57th AVENUE. I wasn't paying attention so we got lost. Oops! :)  Anyway, finally got there and had a good lunch. The place is clean and the folks are nice. We had the Beef Meatballs soup and spring rolls. The food was a little bland for me, but my husband liked it; he's got a new lunch place for when he works in the area.

awLe8VuewikvRlfBolypqA.text: First off the venue is adorable, cute little residential turned to commercial. It's quiet and comfortable and the food was great!

aGAD1YFvUfM4QWd58zauTg.text: Our first time here and LOVE it. Delicious, fresh veggies & herbs. Excellent, friendly service. Cant wait to return.

Sejc4JyBRI95NTqDuoKJDQ.text: I ordered a catfish dish. Amazing. Spicy and sweet and sour catfish. This was fantastic. My wife ordered spicy chicken with fried rice. It was wonderful. The egg rolls were great. Wrap them in lettuce with cilantro and mint. Wonderful flavor for the palet. Clean and homey little place. Loved the experience. The staff was great. Never needed to ask for a thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States

bm2lh5FV_p3o8pjk11lakA.text: For a nice spot to grab lunch in downtown Glendale, this is one of our favorites.  Good food, and good value for what you get.

aaBKeBbWW1mT3oR9a6t18w.text: Pretty dang good food. Service was alright. A little on the slow side. Spring rolls weren't the greatest, but I did enjoy the chicken and shrimp plate I ordered. Pretty inexpensive.  I'd definitely go back if I'm back in Glendale, AZ.

Pg7CyxX4GiYyo-t9zYAP7A.text: 1st time here? Try a rice bowl, #50 is AMAZING. I also suggest you save room for desert, the shaved snow is FANTASTIC!

zV4eDfrXmskFuI6wlojW_g.text: Great food, great service, and will come back. I recommend every dish as they are all good and authentic. The family who owns it is real nice and sometime would greet you personally.

DeTJPVe3Z2T1oT9-ihB7mQ.text: I went this restaurant after reading from Yelp even tho it is kind of far from me.  The food was good, but what I like more about this place was the atmosphere.  It made me feel like I am in Vietnam. I liked that. Honestly I am not sure about the taste. I didn't feel really special but I liked it because I like Vietnamese food anyway!

DGLFFgy-Q0CBXuX6Lz3Ucg.text: What do I dream about when I'm back in NYC? I'll tell you: the supremely delicious banh khot that's made to perfection at Little Saigon. I've never had anything like it in my life, and I only wish I didn't have to wait for summer vacation to enjoy it again.  I've loved this Little Saigon for years: it's a charming place, the people are fantastic, and yes, there are many other things on the menu that are superb. But the banh knot has captured my heart!

h1Ey5MSxwp28ESDxdQVoZg.text: Best PHO in ARIZONA. sooo fresh and sooo good. Service is amazing and so are other dishes. I was very surprised with their taro bubble tea as well- fresh taro instead of powder..say what??!

QH61FVa_vFFuBZm20YQXzQ.text: My first Pho! I never understood why you see the food network people get all excited as they describe the pho they are eating and the layers of flavor... now I GET IT! AWESOME! I love pho! The spring rolls are spectacular too! The servers are very helpful when you are ordering, taking the time to explain everything!

8Cm6Kv_i3jps9wFTR5qBxQ.text: Title: Awesome Vegetarian dishes, fellow Vegheads!  ooo...My BFF and me hit this place after the Glendale Blues/Jazz Festival the other day and were pleasantly surprised. If you blink, you pass this puppy. We only found it cause we went one street too far wondering where we parked our motorcycles.  We're Veg, so we ordered from the Vegetable entree menu and split everything.  #78 Vegetarian coconut curry  - Awesome flavor although I hate white rice, it all meshed together beautifully.  #80 Flash-fried tofu with carmelized onions and tangy soy sauce - It's the sweet soy sauce that made this dish.  #84 Bok choy soup with ginger and onions - amaaaaazing flavor. Highly recommended. Tasted good for leftovers too. mmmm. mmmm  Price was hella right, peeps. Only $6.99 for each of these delicious dishes. Say wha?????  Cheap date night fer sure!  There were only like 2 servers so the service was a bit slow but very friendly.   As of  4/9/11, they weren't serving alcohol per a few posted signs. I assume waiting for a liquor license to come through.  Will be eating at this gem and recommending to friends every chance I get.

juTUUtyod8KdecpVUYjtxg.text: I ran here on a whim last weekend because I was in the area and it was recommended to me by a friend, so glad I did. I ordered the #38 with a chicken substitute instead of the pork and it was pretty tasty, the fried rice was excellent, the meat was tender and marinated just right, even the egg roll was good. I will definitely be back.

xa2902pmGhEyn9s_s3GujA.text: The hubby and I had a yummy lunch on our "day date" today.  I had the 37 (pork, shrimp, fried egg on the perfect white rice) the Hubby had the 47 (steak, bells, onions, rice) we also shared the potstickers app.  I like the iced tea a lot. Very mild green tea.  The app was my favorite part, very good! I loved the fried egg on the rice, and really, the rice was the example of what perfect rice is. The pork chop was very yummy. I tried the Hubby's steak and it was very good, and I love the deep caramel onions, wish there were more.  I wasn't blown away with the salad and sauce, Saigon Kitchen set that bar high for me.  I very much look forward to coming back, trying other things on the menu, like Pho in the winter :) oh yeah.

Tr6Sl37pzfIzbw3OAjbuCA.text: They have the best pho here. Initially I was a little uncertain as I had loved the pho in Chicago, but This little place is great! They also have really good spring rolls and rice.

Kdk-EhGhYuz2VRCHnMe9gA.text: Our preferred pho place in PHX. Delicious broths and lots of choices make for a fun time at lunch or dinner. Speedy service means we are never late for Yotes puck drop!

lcecBU7fGB-3JTewGdrISg.text: Excellent food, adorable restaurant. Very small and cozy. The staff was very friendly.

m63fR7cHRwRmDb4s9ck_2g.text: We eat here almost every other week.  The soups are out of this world.  Anything you order here is going to be awesome.  Highly recommend this place.

pXWnsk7F2ui_8VSGPy-Crw.text: Amazing food! I love it...perfect and fast service, my fist time here and I will be definitely back for more sprig rolls

HHuctPXHNkQaoiBqsiQmLA.text: Quick summary... this place is awesome! It's located in a cute little part of Glendale in what must have been a house at some point. The service was excellent. We had a super sweet waiter who was very attentive. Their fresh spring rolls were good (and served in a cute little divided dish)  although a little hard to eat.. My filling kept falling into the peanut sauce. The Pho was good as well.. there wasn't a ton of beef in it but it was still filling and the price was right so it didn't bother me much. They offer a variety of imported beer options which is fun and their thai tea boba was delish. Definitely a neat little find while driving through Phoenix on the way back to Tucson. The prices were also the best I've seen for Pho in a while. I'd love to come back here.

J9M0DNtKhnyMlFtC-bCjxg.text: took my parents and brother here and everybody loved it! I've gone back multiple times since then! Great food at great prices!

4dh5tlq-GwD83fDTmBi0Ug.text: If you are wondering if this restaurant is worth trying, welll stop wondering. This place has very authentic Vietnamese food. The owners are very nice and interact with the customers all day. My personal favorite dish would have to be the Lemongrass Chicken. It's location is perfect for the residents of Glendale because there aren't very many Vietnamese restaurants in the Northwest part of Phoenix.

sundEKPUmgqWd7SqxzlQtg.text: Pho was very good. Huge portion, like normal, so you could share. I got the shrimp and chicken rice plate. The chicken was tender and soft, but also well cooked. Nice sweet flavor.

i6fjoPp7fEVDz2vp-bAiUQ.text: This is the second time I've been here and it is amazing. The pho is on point and the potstickers are soooo good, I most definitely will be coming back again!!

LCENWdytp3-nL_nXV-GtOg.text: I'm happy to see this place is doing very well, I remember them back in the days at christown mall (spectrum mall)  They were busy but our waitress which is the daughter was good with communication skills to let us know the status of our orders.  I appreciate the times she still came to check up on us, the food was very good, very fresh, and price was very good.  There's not a lot of good Vietnamese restaurants in Arizona, but this one is probably the best due to their consistency and authentic flavor.  Not to be racist but I also noticed Viet people cooking the food in the kitchen instead of Hispanics, which is a plus for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Vietnamese pancake with shrimp only

obhkzV9dXlezhXrBzJQ4eg.text: This is my favorite restaraunt.   Period.  I did not grow up eating Vietnamese food, but it's now my favorite.

68nH60cmi1SETj2x4JBBBg.text: I went for first time to this place I was really pleased with food and service I ordered the rice paper spring roll with shrimp and pork (MUST HAVE) a chx broth pho and also the rice vermicelli bowl w shrimp, If you're really into noodles this is the place 100% recommended. Plus place is super cozy!

B5EFfvieYYlpG5T3gDpygA.text: Our first experience here, we ordered the egg rolls and spring rolls.  Both were fresh and the egg rolls were hot.  The spring roll was delicious with the homemade sauce. That in itself was almost a small meal. The grilled beef with Bok choi was simply amazing, hot and fresh.  I accompanied my plate with Sriracha which took it to another dimension.  My sister order the veggie rice noddle soup w/ extra chicken.  It smelled awesome, the classic Pho soup with all the veggies.  The taste was outta this world. Definitely coming back to this place.

qezPTn3JVyF4e2161IffPw.text: A delightful, delicious, darling place to go. The house is historic in downtown Glendale. Very pretty with twinkle lights on the outside. I love old buildings. I had the curry and it was delicious. Service was good too. Everyone tells me this is the place to go to get Pho. I will have to come back and check that out.

V-v-wDWrKLBcFBGtTq48bg.text: This place has a great feel once you first walk in their door. The fish tank is really cool too! The fish seem exotic or something? Really, really neat. The place is not very big in size, which gives it that intimate dive restaurant feel. The courtyard/ patio in the front would be great for a group if you looking for a little more room.  This place is right in the heart of old town Glendale. Parking was not an issue at all when I went for lunch time. I parked in the thrift store parking then walked over. Seemed like a few others were doing the same thing as I noticed pulling up to the restaurant.   Once I got sat I noticed the menu was mostly in Vietnamese and had English translation as well. I wasn't sure what to order, as it was my very first time being here, or even to a Vietnamese restaurant for that matter. The server recommended the Pho, and a eves dropping customer also insisted that I try the Pho.   So I ordered the Beef and Shrimp Pho, along with some fresh spring rolls and  a Coors Light to drink. The Spring rolls where very different than what I was used to. They were extremely fresh wrapped in a weird film like texture of some sort. It was very delicious! The dipping sauce that comes with the rolls is perfect for the rolls. They bring out all the add in for the pho before the bowl of broth arrives. The add in consist of mint, cilantro, lemon, jalapenos, and some type of sprout root. Once I tried the Pho, I was blown away by out great it all was! It was actually really exciting and fun eating Pho since it was my first time. I can now see why everyone keeps recommending the Pho here!  What a great experience! I cannot wait to return here again.

Uh-IjG_wVBV2RPbOqCftNw.text: Pretty decent Pho but I've had better; I've definitely had worse also. I also tried the shrimp spring roll, it is was decent also.

td7-MVToEeQjupBtWn3NWg.text: I want to remember so hard what number each meal I've tried are but I can't. So I'll just kinda explain.  First time I ordered Jasmine Tea and their crispy noodles I want to say #26. Loved the crunchy noodles!!!! I added some of the chili paste they have on the table just because I love it, but really it doesn't need anything else. The veggies were on point and although it didn't have many pieces of chicken I had so much fun enjoying the noodles I forgot their was supposed to be chicken on my plate. Haha!  My husband ordered a plate that had shrimp and chicken with a salad and rice. The rice is perfectly done and the chicken tasted good. You could taste the coconut oil which to me tastes amazing.  On a different ocasion I had the spicy chicken with lemon grass. When it came out it was served in a plate that was sizzling hot which means it will stay hot for a while since I talk to much. You can taste the lemon grass and whatever else they add to this. They bring some steamed rice for you and you can either pour the chicken on the rice or add the rice to the plate. I mean you can eat it however you want the outcome is the same! DELISH!  I ordered a limeade which on the menu it specifically says they make it there. It's good!  Haven't tried the rest of their stuff and will definitely go back to try different numbers on their menu!  Let me add it's not expensive either! Ha! Who doesn't like delicious food for a fair price! This girl!!!  Enjoy! Don't be scared to check it out!

JxB6O1cefkMn2rAz81pthA.text: I loved my visit here.  I loved the food, the decor, and the lights all around the tiny little house they've turned into a restaurant.  We decided to go to the last night of Glendale Glitters and we were hungry.  My companion was looking for a Subway restaurant, but I sort of whined a little about how cute this place was from the outside, and he agreed to check it out with me.  WOW!  Was he ever glad he did!  I had something with shrimp and chicken, and spring rolls and a Thai Iced tea with boba.  My companion had the yellow curried chicken.  His curry smelled so good, I wanted to cry. Then I tasted it.  It was amazing!   The spring rolls were literally the best I've ever had, and the shrimp was cooked perfectly. Why not 5 stars?  Only because I've only been there once.  It get's 5 stars if we drive all the way back to Glendale just to eat here.  we shall see. In the meantime, if you live anywhere near, go!!

bHUosGRX6V0bar3yC6oekg.text: I love this place.  I've been there twice.  The steamed catfish was some of the best catfish I've ever had, and probably much healthier than the fried catfish you would find elsewhere.  Their pork was excellent too, not to mention their superb desserts.  I strongly recommend getting the fried banana.    Moreover, the servers made me feel very relaxed and at ease.  The Vietnamese are a chill, friendly group of people who really know how to blend different flavors into pleasant dishes.

YhTDJHQg01cJbr55E7C4OA.text: Had the spring rolls (#2) and the #22, which was amazing!!!! Fast service, too! Wish I lived closer.

aIpH7EG8932tCCXx2VdxPQ.text: Disgusting, I am an avid pho lover searching all over the Phoenix area for the best pho and this place is by far the worst I've had. The broth was greasy, the brisket was harshly over cooked and the tendon and organ meat WAS no clean and tasted horrible. I left with a huge stomach ache. Don't come here!

mGtJrhAjJBafW7Gcc0jyBg.text: Wonderful food. Great staff. Nice to families with small children. The VIET ICED COFFEE is so good. I went in sick with a head cold and feeling like I was done for 2 or 3 days. The waitress told me that a big bowl of PHO would make me feel better. A big bowl of Viet style Chicken Noodle Soup and lots of tea and I felt human again. I bought another portion to take away. Tastier than any cold medicine. The food here is better when You are healthy and You can taste it. Enjoy

U0UuKHJYzDsc5KT8ufvptw.text: Loved this place, very quaint and cute for a get together. I had their springrolls and they were made fresh. tphijJRbLu6lTKSfG1s_MA.text: Another amazing meal. Pork and steak dishes are fantastic.  As usual, pho didn't disappoint. Great food with reasonable prices.

qBcObAvXPUK16mhJUyPPZg.text: I've been to about 20 Vietnamese places. I mainly get pho or rice plates but this place is great. Pho soup tasted great, eggrolls (kinda on the small size) but still taste awesome. And the rice plates or awesome. This was the first time I've had a beef salad and it was soooo good. I would recommend it. Out of all the places I have ate pho this place ranks in my top 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Got a rice plate and it was DA BOMB. Kinda got to excited and forgot to take a picture before I started eating.

YzEfpMaOw2l8-6EaupOVrQ.text: My favorite restaurant in town.  Some of my favorite dishes include the pho ga (chicken soup) (#8), spicy lemongrass chicken (#51), marinated beef in grape leaves (#62), and steamed catfish in black pepper sauce (#65).  The combo spring rolls are the best I have ever had at any Vietnamese restaurant, and I have tried them at many places.  The prices are very reasonable, and the owners are very nice people.  We regularly make a fairly long drive to have dinner at Little Saigon because it has great food at a very good price.  Highly recommended.

Vj5AiMcHvsKsRyB2GatQaA.text: I am very familiar with Thai food, being part Thai and all. Vietnamese food on the other hand is a different adventure for me. Yes I have had it a few times, but what I had was nothing to write home about. I saw the reviews of Little Saigon on yelp, and persuaded my husband on a very hot 115 degree day to try it with me.  We are fans! We started out with the spring rolls. Not the deep fried kind but the fresh rolled kind, it had vermicelli stuffed with shrimp, herbs and grilled sliced pork. These are some of the best around. Most places just use the unflavored sliced pork, this was actually sliced,marinated and grilled. Made a huge difference in the taste. The only way it could be improved, would be the addition of some mint. The peanut sauce that it came with was good, different from the Thai peanut sauce I am used to but good. We ordered the regular iced tea. It was clear and refreshing. I usually order the salted plum or salted lemonade drinks whenever I have Vietnamese cuisine, but did not want anything with salt as it was so hot outside. I ordered the #38, it came with 3 grilled shrimp,a thin cut of grilled marinated pork tenderloin, white rice and an over medium egg on top. It had a few pieces of lettuce,daikon,carrot,cucumber, and tomato on the side served with a mini fried eggroll with minced pork inside.  They brought out the sweetened fish sauce to go with it  and I was happy with my selection. The pork was tender with a minimal amount of fat around the edges, and the shrimp was butterflied. The eggroll was not greasy and it was crisp. Overall I would order it again, but want to try something different next time around. My husband got the #56. Pork short ribs that fell off the bone, and shrimp served in a clay bowl floating in  a delectable peppery brown broth, with carmelized onions, and a garnish of green onions on top. Served with white rice on the side.The ribs tasted a bit like re heated meat, but the sauce/broth made up for it. The prices and portion size are just right. I would rather pay for good quality than quantity of food that other places dish out.  It is a bit hard to find. There are no big signs that stand off the road, we actually passed it then turned around. The setting is in what used to be an older home. They have a nice patio that I can see spending some great nights with friends outside in the early spring.  Inside, there are a few different rooms. Maybe a few tables in each room. The main room has tables to fit a larger crowd. We ended up in a smaller room to ourselves. I think it's a great place to bring a date without breaking your wallet. The place was very clean. Even the restrooms. That's a key right there. If the restrooms are dirty at a restaurant, guess how the kitchen must be?  We will come back to this place and I see it as becoming one of our favorites. The service was friendly and I would rather give my hard earned money to a family owned and operated restaurant than a chain any day! This would be a great place to start off dinner before going to the Glendale art walks or Glendale Glitters! Give them a try!

ZWzBB_-AwYO2y7zYs48eXA.text: Okay, I'll admit it: one of the reasons I love going into any type of Eastern restaurant is because I'm still fairly ignorant of the cuisine.  Sure, I'll try just about anything, but half the time, I still don't know what it even is I'm ordering.  I really enjoy that.  The reason I bring that up is that there is SO much to try on the menu at Little Saigon.  It's a pretty sizable menu, and it might not be ideal for the indecisive.  Luckily, the size of the menu did not seem to diminish the skill at which it was prepared.  The appetizers looked like something out of a gourmet food magazine.  The main dishes (at least mine) was served literally still boiling and bubbling.  It all tasted as good as it smelled.  Oh, and since I seem to be addicted to trying new things, I'll advise you on this: the salted plum tea is actually surprisingly good.  While I'm no expert on Vietnamese cuisine, I'm sure I'll find myself back here soon to keep learning.

N55sLKiN2phQp5XwUpDGZg.text: Hands down THE best Vietnamese spot in the state! Spring rolls are fresh and there is an entree for everyone on the menu. Your mouth will water when you hear the sizzling little pots used to serve their most delicious menu items!

f5EaVd34h8viB4q098L2zg.text: If it were closer to home I would give it a second go, but it's just too far, and was too mediocre for the drive.  I got one of their "Pho" dishes, turkey, ham and beef.  The meat seemed of very low quality, actually made me wish I would have gone veggie.  The spring rolls were alright, but nothing I will be writing home to Mom about. They do have a cool fish tank, which almost bumped them to a 3 star'r.

BJE4gcMuAeewV1gYPrTopw.text: FINALLY... I found our go-to pho place in the West side.  Excellent portion sizes for the price, ton of menu items, and airy atmosphere (good chance you won't smell like the food when you leave).  Only went here once, but definitely good enough to rate it now.  Food updates after a few more eats.

v_SDRfAxU-wKVvA7RkUP1g.text: I've heard about this place and people rave about it. The food was good. I've had better Vietnamese in the valley. I went there with co-workers for lunch because they advertise outdoor seating. They rather rudely told us it was closed . The service is pretty bad. They were rude from the start. We felt like we didn't get enough time to look over the menu before someone was getting us to order. After that everything was good until I notice a cockroach walk across the bottles of sauces and up the wall. I'll spend my money where the service is better, where outdoor seating is available, and cockroach free tables.

IHkgWKwhNMK_YKTNE_FDbw.text: Had the fried rice, spring rolls, and crispy stirred fried flat rice noodle.  I wouldn't say this place is a 4.5 stars but food were decent and fast.  Good service.  Price ranges from 7 to $10 for the entres.

XsK5UmkNQRmAR1T3Ue8Y1Q.text: I guess I shouldn't compare the Vietnamese food in Arizona to Vietnamese back home in San Jose, CA because there is definitely no comparison! If you're Vietnamese and looking for good, authentic Vietnamese food, you won't find it here. The portions are small and when you order drinks, 75% of the cup is filled with ice. I guess if you're really desperately craving, then this place is okay. I, for one, will wait until I go back to Ca to fulfill all my cravings.

HjKUixC0kEIUYHpX6fFD6A.text: I go to this place on the way home from school. Every time, I order the spicy lemon grass chicken with rice. It is really yummy. Lots of flavor and veggies which I love.  However, I dislike like how they give me only one bowl of rice. I love rice! I always order extra and the end up giving me no charge which is great. The waiters and the owner who is the main cook in the back are super nice!

8D4e-xqF4L2phu0qTRHNIg.text: My biggest complaint is that it will take me years to get through the menu! Their food is good and its a True family run business. The atmosphere is quaint and intimate. Whenever I go I get the server to bring me whatever they recommend at the time. I have never had the same thing twice!

zjFoK02xCdLV3JFnkmP4GQ.text: Still the best Vietnamese food in town. For that matter, the best asian comfort food. Always a good meal. My wife and I hadn't been in almost six months (stupid diets) took a friend from out of town last night, and it was amazing... just like we remembered it. John (the owners son) and his wife Ha, remembered us, and asked us where we had been! LOVE THIS PLACE. This is a must try restaurant!

Sqsi-fQdiPRNZZGLY6Naxg.text: Although I have highly raved about Little Saigon, it appears that service can be hit or miss. I initially had a 5 star review rating food, environment and service. However, awhile back I visited with family during lunch time it was not at all busy and we waited approximately 15 minutes to just be greeted and seated, another 15 mins or so for someone to get to our table to greet and order drinks and again 15-20 minute wait for food and the orders for a family of (3) didn't come out at the same time. My Brother's dish was forgotten about and had to wait again another 15 minutes or so.  During our visit it was extremely SLOW.  Many other patrons were also not greeted and waited a long time. I was surprised when this had occurred with the Owners who were both working at the time and on the floor.  I am reserving my thoughts a bit on how I feel about this place. It once was a great find to quickly turn into a bad experience. A shame when I had family who visited from out of state and we drove 16+ miles to dine here because I raved about it so highly.  This particular visit was disappointing. I've been back once after this and the service and food was very good. Perhaps a VERY OFF day for them.

EJ_maBc099bVxdx9k4HKzw.text: I've been coming here for a few years and I enjoy it every-time. The food is fresh and delicious and service is fast.

LCfSE1Bq8-ySbZi5-YSZPQ.text: I reviewed Little Saigon once before but I have to again. This place is seriously the best kept secret in the valley. The service is superb. The Vietnamese cuisine is so good here too; it's incredible. My family and I recently went to Disneyland and stopped off in the actual "little Saigon" in Garden Grove California and ate at a couple of restaurants there. The food from Little Saigon here in Glendale was hands down better and the menu is more extensive. They offer far more selection than your average Vietnamese place. Also the spring rolls are about the best I've ever had. Try them and tell me I'm wrong. The Pho is always awesome. Get the #12 it has all the delicious bits you want! The vermicelli salads are perfect for a quick lunch or for an after dinner midnight snack (I usually order one to go after our meal, I'm fat, we like to eat, don't judge me). The crispy crepe is on another level of deliciousness. Packed full of mint, shrimp, pork, bean sprouts, served with daikon, carrot, lettuce, and sweet fish sauce. Roll it up in the lettuce, dip it in the fish sauce, and punch your ticket to flavor heaven. I will warn you this appetizer is the equivalent of crack cocaine. You will have to have more. You will find yourself driving not of your own accord to get your Vietnamese fix and it will begin with you mainlining some crepes and spring rolls. I'm an addict too so I know...

E8k9iLhiuk_mdc03F3h4OA.text: The pho + other entrees are pretty standard, but the thing that sets this place apart from the rest are their EGGROLLS.  Being an Asian from the Bay Area Ca (an Asian Mecca) I've searched high and low for adequate Asian food in Phoenix (a landscape that pretty much only caters to hamburgers and burritos) and I must say that Little Saigon has the BEST EGGROLLS in the Valley, hands down.

FhL4I4HQFKx1SU8DgjtllA.text: Best Vietnamese food in AZ! I'm so in love with this place that I plan on coming here for years to come....yummy!

_DJd4mczGB0Vq9HUgvlKLQ.text: Little Saigon is the best Vietnamese food I've had in the Phoenix area.  The restaurant is family owned and the food is great.  I suggest the Rice Vermicelli with grilled pork and shrimp.

x-9sUPluxvUCJ1ip4KO2Gw.text: I had pho, spring roll & spicy chicken wings made with Vietnamese chili sauce which was fiery hot but tastey. This is a place where you go for quick eats it's simple fast & tasty.

J3rsurUf8Mci_HpLK4AbwQ.text: This is the first place I tried pho at! It was amazing! I guess you can say it's where I lost my phoginity . I went there with my friend who knows about all the pho places around. She taught me how it goes.   Let me tell you, the broth was really flavorful. I know that many people have talked about how good pho was, but I was completely clueless to dish until I tried it. It does live up to its name of being delicious. This place does a great job of keeping it that way.   The place inside is a bit small, but if I can recall, I remember that they have a private dining room or so. The outside of this place however, the building is so cute. I love the little plants around and the dim warm light setting that they have going on.   I would totally recommend anyone who is interested in going here or looking for a place of similar foods. The menu is quite limited but that does not stop me from giving this place 5 stars!

nR34i4nqXYOeDJH2VxMiQw.text: Best pho in phx area. Tried the limited time oxtail pho... man it's tasted delicious. Meat was perfectly tender, flavorful broth. Lady's were very friendly and welcoming. Will be back.

jrXev7fGtPBUnasEeG0RmA.text: This place has the best PHO in town small little cozy place as well. Nice people and great environment. I will totally recommend trying it out.

8hXC1pzJlKYGcJsEvhLZmw.text: I come for the Pho and the pot stickers! Great service and atmosphere and wonderful food. Parking can be a bit difficult but that's common in the area due to location.

FnXXIQXrRDfkbWaDKWbgwg.text: Visited this place a couple times and I'm always pleased with the food. We went about 30 min before they closed, so we had to order quick. We were pretty much in and out. Our server was very sweet and took care of us well. I also enjoyed seeing the outdoor lights hanging out on the patio, it brings more charm to the charming little restaurant/house. We will surely visit again.

7kfMXU0UmGGOTe2yJXsQEA.text: It deserves more than 5 stars! It is the cutest little cottage with a Beautiful fish tank. Five star food at a one star price. For appetizers we had egg rolls, spring rolls and pot stickers. Each had their own different delish dipping sauce,  with fresh mint. For lunch I had #95 chicken cabbage salad. I cant remember the real names, #'s of the other 2 dishes one was the vegetarian coconut curry dish and we added side of chicken. The other was a main dish with chicken pork, beef? and noodles. All 3 dishes had their own unique flavor. The salad had a nice mint kick, the curry was rich and spicy. The meat one was delish too just not as bold of a flavor. We also got 2 Thai teas. It stuffed all of us for $57!! We even had leftovers!! Looking forward to our next visit to AZ to eat here again! If you love vietnamese you will Love Little Saigon!!

Qb7aS22cUDdv9B2HdE1bWg.text: I ordered the grilled chicken rice plate with a fried egg and shrimp. Great authentic Vietnamese food, it is a far drive for me so I don't come here often.  The Vietnamese coffee isn't as strong as most Vietnamese coffees I've tried.  Lots of different dishes to choose from!

egxuXPs5IiBn6I651plWHQ.text: Popped in for lunch.  Service was good ...my food choices not so much.   The potstickers (pan fried) looked amazing but didn't have any flavor.  The filling was white and stringy...perhaps chicken? Hard to say, likely boiled and lacking any ginger or other spices. Seriously no flavor.   The pho. Ordered the beef combo (#11 I think). Again...this dish also lacked flavor. Regarding the broth, it  had a watered down flavor.  The tendon had a strange almost sour taste.   Was surprised with all the great reviews...but in reviewing them again, it appears Pho is the thing to avoid.

EYSx27d5S3hQqYi3PCzvEw.text: First of all, I like the set up where an old house in the heart of Glendale is converted into a restaurant.   Secondly, I keep coming back here because they have the best Fresh Spring Roll in town. The thinly sliced meat has flavor which makes a big difference.   Their cubed rib-eye steak is also a favorite. Try their Sticky Rice with Mango dessert after.

nCUssmO_AFOWsBm33-Q90g.text: I have found a new favorite restaurant!!! I have thought about when my next visit will be from the moment I left after my first visit.  Great service, great food, wish I had found this amazing hidden gem sooner!!!!

HHII0OsgNB5DzisGm3cUsg.text: Why I didn't find this gem a long time ago seems to really amuse me. Came here with my sister, while in my pho moods. I have really been struggling to find some really good pho out here in Arizona. Side note I moved out here from la (aka: city with the best foods) and I have been missing a good bowl of pho!  Ordered the chicken pho, veggie egg rolls, and dessert! I have to admit this was probably the best pho I have had In Arizona. Very quick authentic the broth was made to perfection. My mouth is literally watering just thinking about it. Lol   If you're a pho addict/lover/enthusiast you have to stop by here and try a bowl! I promise you won't regret it! Customer service is great our waitress was very helpful and attentive. Menus are to the point short and sweet just how I like them lol

Rxcs2M4fiOT4RQX9SnNfwg.text: This is my first time in Phoenix, Az with my coworker on a business trip. After a long working day on August 15, 2018, we were hungry and had a crave for Vietnamese food. We searched Google and decided to try Little Saigon Restaurant in Glendale (Az). We arrived at the restaurant at 7:15pm, and ordered "Pho Ap Chao #26 and Bun Bo Xao #32". When the Pho Ap Chao dish came out, we noticed that the beef was missing, and politely asked the 2 waitresses "where is the beef ?" (because the dish should have beef, pork, chicken, veggie and semi crispy flat noodle). Both waitresses said the beef is in there but my coworker could not find any beef in the dish.  So we asked the elderly Vietnamese owner of the restaurant, also politely, the same question "where is the beef?".  The owner yelled back with a loud voice, in Vietnamese, "I am the owner and been here for 13 years with no complain until now and don't come back".  We were stunned and speechless by his bad attitude response in an uneducated manner.    So Beware and take your chance of encountering BAD service and attitude from this restaurant owner.  There are many other Asian/Vietnamese restaurant with 4-stars plus rating nearby!  We will not come back!

qGIC--MYxOVzueg0GYtQtg.text: Food was so good! Fast and friendly service  will return. My picky daughter's loved the chicken pho and were already planning our return for some more. Highly recommended

rJmDmeA8nnHeO-qR7Uhr0w.text: I have to respond to Elza M's self-absorbed review today about Little Saigon, as I was also a customer waiting my turn to have lunch on this very busy Tuesday. This young woman wanted to walk in and sit at an empty table instantly and not wait 5 minutes. She's obviously used to fast food counter service. This is a top shelf restaurant, famous for their fresh dishes and blessing us all with some very capable and kind waiters. When Elza started to demand to sit down, the waitresses were flat out covering more tables than they should already.   Elza, when you dropped some attitude and stormed out, you really missed out on a fabulous meal. I recommend #22 next time, when you have the time to savor the best food and service in Glendale.

0UJvVSRchLQq5bTLmfhhEw.text: Yay! A really neat cottage looking Vietnamese restaurant in Glendale. Thank you Yelp for this little golden nugget :)  I ordered the fresh spring rolls and was so impressed. Sometimes the outside wrapper tends to be chewy and tough but this one was definitely freshly made. Delicious!   I also got the chicken pho. Loved the broth and the fresh veggies that came with it for garnish. I enjoyed my meal thoroughly. Can't wait to come back and try some other dishes I saw other patrons get. It looked delightful and they appeared to all be very satisfied.  Service is quick and friendly. Facilities are clean. Street parking right in front is nice :)

hJ9CaFDKzoBAQyhIpEg6XQ.text: Always a great and delicious meal aling with good service! Been coming for years and never disappointed!

km2sJZ3KOudB3fWDvFpHbw.text: Great little place. We always wanted to try it and finally had the chance. We have gone to many Pho places around the valley and this one definitely ranks up there. Very fresh and the place is spotless. The number 11 is definitely a hit. The number 26 was a bit small on portion but not on taste. The drinks we had were Taro Boba, Thai Tea Boba, and Vietnamese IceCoffee which my wife says is too strong but I totally enjoyed it. Come check them out but be prepared to wait.
