Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Soooo cute!!!!!!
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Number 11 yummy!!!!

TaCvTZMenncCyTodZ8hKzw.text: Great little family run restaurant in downtown Glendale.  Right near antique stores and in the historic part.  The restaurant is in a quaint old house.  There are not to many Vietnamese restaurants that I've been to with atmosphere so that's an added plus.  The food is also great too.  If you love Vietnamese food you have to try this place.  If you haven't had it check out their website.  There you will find the menu and pictures of some of their food items.  Huge menu!  They don't have Vietnamese sandwiches here though.  They have a family member with a restaurant off I-17 and Bell to get your banh mi fix.  I have had the rice flour crepe with shrimp, pork and bean sprouts.  It is served with a plate of veggies.  It fills up the plate!  I also had the famous #37 with grilled pork, shrimp, egg roll and sunny side up egg.  Really good.  You'll see why it is so popular.  I also had the Pho with sliced beef.  It was not the best I ever had but very, very good.    The service is pretty good here.  The second time I went there they were fairly busy so I had to wait a short time to get seated.  The other two times they were pretty quick.  Servers were all friendly.     It is a good drive from my house but totally worth it plus It's in a great part of Glendale.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. The famous #37 with grilled pork and shrimp with a sunny side up egg.
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States

7xsC4Qb0vWiG-JixnV_YQA.text: Great mom and pop Vietnamese.  "Hidden" location, super friendly service, clean bright atmosphere and good food.  My word of mouth for Little Saigon is get some of this food in your mouth.  I was with Mark R. today, but I may bring my wife here on a date.  The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable.      I did the goi-cuon-chay and then mi-xao-me.  I asked then to make the stir-fry noodles (mi-xao) extra spicy, but it was medium at best. The red chili paste on the table made it easy to add heat, so no problem there.    Digression: The spice issue brings out one of my double standards.  I want authentic ethnic food but, not authentic atmosphere.  Anyone else who has been outside the resort in a third world country should agree.    To the point Little Saigon was bright clean and comfortable and the food was great.  Fire up your GPS and come on down!

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States

eP3a1QeNJbH45w8NEJ0Qeg.text: Had one of the Vermicelli salad bowls with chicken, quite amazing. A combination of sweet and spice with mint and cilantro. It's amazing and I recommend it. Service was great and a very friendly atmosphere.

8fDtj1038zHwY-Qs8rp9UQ.text: Really good food. Really fast and very accommodating. Broth was amazing. Waiter was great to work with.

HxD8Ft0onuoGC22ONWBi9g.text: Just a great Vietnamese place in Glendale. Had spring rolls, pho, beef in xo sauce, shrimp in curry sauce, calamari and the beef/ shrimp combo and they were all winners. The service was great and were treated like family!!

kIN1rQRRwMD5jPivusA9Jw.text: The best curry ever! We got #53, wanted to lick the bowl it was so delicious. Service awesome and super affordable.

QNjJfyt_A14Nif8psz4z3Q.text: Little Saigon has been our favorite Vietnamese restaurant for over ten years!  Mind you that we don't live in the Phoenix area.  The food is always fresh and it is always 100% perfect.  Each time we go there are other Vietnamese customers dining at the restaurant, which then tells me that the food is authentic.    Throughout the years I have tasted most of their food offerings and it is always flavorful.

qaxI0-Voz44cIeklIunlcg.text: Lived close to this restaurant for years and never thought to stop until my bestie had me stop in. SO GLAD that she referred me. Very yummy, family owned.   Makes me want to go there now :-)

pVPibbajQACauYPYrmMOFA.text: We drove 25 mins to this restaurant after a recommendation. When we arrived, there was a sign that said 'wait to be seated' and a sign in sheet. We signed in and waited. Servers saw us but ignored us. Figured they are busy. But the restaurant doesn't seem to be that busy. We decided to wait a little bit longer. A server saw us and turned and walked the other direction.. Hmm there were also other people behind us. Guess they just didn't care. After 15 or so mins of them not acknowledging us we left. Sometimes it's a hit or miss for good service but the drive was too far and the unnecessary wait was irritating. Might try this restaurant again if in the area.

epIcELdORvk0Ob_NODGScw.text: Took us a while to finally make it here, but I'm glad we did- it was a treat! This place is tucked into a side street in downtown Glendale and I'm sort of sad that it took us so many years to get here. Service was fast and friendly even though there was a pretty steady stream of people coming in.   The food was all delicious. I had beef pho, and hubs had some sort of roll your own spring roll thing. This was some of the best pho I've had here, and I've tried more than a few. The broth actually had enough flavor that I almost didn't have to add the extra garnish, but of course I did anyways. It was salty, tangy, and just a little bit sweet. The beef was cut up into manageable pieces and there were tons of rice noodles. We had spring rolls and a strawberry boba smoothie that were equally good. While this place was a dollar or so more per plate than Da Vang, it was closer and the food was better.

0UHLPuCkGyQzOmZg3rNqUA.text: Pretty good when you need close by Pho place... Good service every time I go there. Pretty fast with their food. 4 stars, not enough seating while waiting to get waited on.

L-iGqs4cdaLxL9pP3L3t4g.text: I come for the beef Pho and potstickers! I've come here like 15 times to eat and while I want to try some new things, I just crave their beef Pho and potstickers all the time so I always order that. Pho broth is full of flavor, ingredients are fresh, and meat is tender. The potstickers are just amazing and the dipping sauce is perfect. It's very reasonably priced, the food is great, and staff is always friendly. Not to mention, siracha, chili, and hoisen is on the table so you aren't limited to just a little! The restaurant is really small, very casual, but very cute.

kq0SwoZ84twMC5kDwJKbfQ.text: *DISCLAIMER* Awful and unapologetic service! Though many reviews offered high marks for this restaurant's food, in my book, the thing that sets the tone of the restaurant is its service. When we (3) first entered the restaurant, no one greeted us and there was a party of 10 and 2 in front us. Many people showed up after us, so it seemed that the restaurant was popular. After 25 minutes, the party of 2 left while the party before us waited an hour before they were seated. And yet even after they had just been seated, a party member had to grab the menus themselves from the front because of the lack of service. If a restaurant receives as many high reviews, then high quality service has to be accompanied with it. I don't care if the food supposedly tastes good. If the servers don't even apologize, let alone acknowledge you, why bother?

dBlUIwCH3B8kO6us9UmAKw.text: Went on a Sunday afternoon with my brother since we were near downtown Glendale.  It is slightly hidden, but if you have Yelp you will FIND it.   =)  It is a house converted to a restaurant, so it is pretty small.    I ordered #1 Cha Gio:  Deep-fried egg rolls filled with ground pork.  Dip those yummies in the sweet fish sauce, I am gravy!  These were good, but I still preferred the "normal" size egg rolls.  Then I got #8 Pho Ga: rice noodle soup with shredded chicken.  The soup base is pretty good, plenty of noodles and cooked to the right texture, and the shredded chicken not fatty so excellent.  I also ordered the soy bean milk.    All in all I like the place and the food, but it is on the pricey side for Vietnamese food compared to other places.  Oh the service there is great.  The two servers were like basketball players.  In sync and great teamwork to make the customers happy.

_ZQ_dT6I74IbLgy7cS-Eig.text: Really, really, REALLY bad customer service. We were practically chased out by a staffer who just didn't want any more customers.

80THiw9Od6jiFrvGlGcBxA.text: Love the quaint cottage appeal and absolutely delicious food!!  Dinner for the price of lunch!  Already making plans to bring friends next time

BJ8t4pPM6ODCfZFXzxkdsg.text: I discovered this place shortly after moving to Glendale and in need of my pho fix. I first tried their pho tai which I wasn't very impressed with. I didn't give up on them though I went back and tried their pho Dac Biet (special pho) and was very impressed. It's my favorite place to get pho Dac Biet in this area. Not only are the portions big the quality of meats is awesome (except for the meatball that goes in, worst meatball ever lol but I don't care much for that), never over cooked and the noodles are always just right. I have also had their pot stickers, egg rolls, and bun thit (vermicelli bowls), all very good.  Don't forget to try their lotus root salad, it's SUPER yummy!

fYQFgwUG2xA7KqoXEGUITw.text: Amazingly good food, fresh and authentic.  I really wasn't expecting much given my other attempts at eating Asian food in Phoenix.  Service is friendly and effecient, portions are generous for the price... it's a little lacking in ambience, but what cheap authentic asian restaurant isn't? ;)  Only been here once, but everyone enjoyed their food.

Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. beef in grape leaves, with all the necessary spring roll ingredients
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. fried banana dessert

iMhgBP2ojyGqzZTikDIg-A.text: I have to say that I have been coming to Little Saigon for years, but never reviewed it?!?  We came down here during Glitter n Glow and now my mind ifs refreshed on how great it was!   First off I love the location and the old restored house where the restaurant is made into. The service has always been good. It's a very nice and quaint feeling instantly when you walk in.   I've tried several items but my personal favorite is the catfish in the black pepper pot with a side of white rice. I've must have had this at least 10 times and I wish I could have it more!! The pepper sauce is amazing and the catfish is tasty.   I've also had the pho and it was also very good.   All in all Little Saigon is one of if not best Vietnamese restaurant in the valley. My personal favorite. I can't wait to go back!

r1eK_yrQbkRbxwnwS5jjqw.text: Being this my first time I'll give it 3 stars. I will go a couple more times and then I can really give it a review but for my first experience it was ok. I got the vegetarian spring rolls and the chicken pho, both were good. Nice flavor and fast service.  The booba tea was good too. The only bad thing that I saw was the people who were sitting across from me were trying to kill a roach that was on the blinds! I'm sure they were loyal regulars or something because they didn't make a scene or said anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States

i6uakauZIBSbUuMM7WgJ-w.text: Actually never tried the food but had the service. Waited 35 minutes without any sort of acknowledgement. Finally had to ask one of the servers and was told it was going to be another 15-20 minutes with a slight smirk. We are "backed up" he said. More then enough tables to seat the additional 4 parties behind us just not smart enough with wait management for a restaurant. No apologies, none needed, because I don't think they really cared. Should have walked out within 15 minutes.

NeGOp-99c8TTxOmHx8ky0A.text: Solid 4. Fair value for your money. Only exception are the tiny pork egg rolls, 6 pieces for 6 and they're the size of my 7 year old pinky finger. The beef pho was ok, the broth was tasty and the beef was very tender. The barbecued pork vermicelli was also tasty fair portion for seven bucks. The shrimp and BBQ pork plate dinner seemed kind of small the shrimp didn't seem very fresh, the BBQ pork was tender and delicious.  Our server was also very good checking up on us , and making sure we were happy with our meal. I'll go back to this place when I'm in Glendale.

YSau3wzR2wqU18h5iINwDA.text: As a restaurant the food is great, the place has a really nice atmosphere to it but as for the boba drinks they were horrible. They only have 2 flavors, Taro and Strawberry, the time I went I got the Taro which it had too much liquid not enough ice, I could feel chunks of ice in my mouth and on top of that I could feel the Taro powder. My sister got the Strawberry which wasn't so bad, so as for the boba drinks I don't recommend them but as for the food, that part they got it covered :)

pHb8a3p97gEB2YjB0l5uqQ.text: If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese pho, you best skip this place. Otherwise, the food is decent. It's a bit on the pricey side. The only size they have is the large bowl and that comes to about $8. I only come here when invited by friends, but there are better choices for pho out there.

jJq4oPN0anJellefgt87Aw.text: Food was good but service wasn't too great. I was there when there were barely any customers so there was no excuse. The waiter didn't seem like he cared and rude in my opinion.

0FsWmWU0BcHAAQ7tKNX5Kw.text: Little Saigon is our new favorite. Since this was our first experience eating Vietnamese food we relied on one of the owners to help us choose.  The food was delicious, from the potstickers to the lemon grass chicken! The atmosphere is warm and friendly.  We will definitely plan a return visit!

32BgNJEUCN754O7G_M4mWQ.text: Awesome little place, great service, good food, actual asians, no annoying music, and reasonable prices.

VtiUh_YMeWGxWjEa-TZlEw.text: If you find yourself in Glendale on a Sunday afternoon looking for food, you don't have a lot of options.  That said, Little Saigon is a great place to stop by.  Located in a converted old home it has a certain charm and is a pleasant place to relax and enjoy a meal.  We had the beef Pho and a Chicken and Shrimp salad and both were very good.  Portions are generous.    The staff was friendly and took care of all our needs.  I would definitely go back when in the area.

clEBqhp0l_TWj_1b_uHR4g.text: We came in Friday night for dinner. There were two parties ahead of us so we passed the time by checking out the menu. Keep in mind, I hate seafood, I don't enjoy the taste, the smell, and I definitely don't like how sick it makes me. Being a Vietnamese restaurant, I knew my options were limited. I hinted to leaving but I lost that battle (thankfully).   We started off with Vegetarian Egg Rolls that were better than most places.   I had chicken Pho (7)  and my bf had a chicken dish (52)  My Pho was AMAZING. I was smiling the whole time and kept uttering, this is AMAZING. I wish he enjoyed his dish as much as I enjoyed mine.   While we were waiting another party politely asked how long it will be. He snapped and said "maybe 10 min, maybe 30, I don't know when people are leaving"  That was enough to make me want to get up and leave. I did not like how he talked to people. When he was seating us some lady gestured that she needed something and he rudely dismissed her.  Once we were seated all the staff was super friendly, but until you are actually at a table they can be quite rude.   5 for my food   2-3 for service

WuL7_ruAFsIMmTOuHepjBQ.text: I've been here twice with the wife.  The first time I ordered a couple spring rolls and loved them so much that (for a while) we started making them at home a few times per week.  I also did the make your own spring roll for the dinner and... it was filling. Fair price and can easily feed 2 people. The staff came and offered to show me how to roll them (I've done it in the past so I declined).  My wife's noodle dish was great. She may have got pad thai but I forget. And the boba is great and has many flavors to choose from.  On our next trip we ordered the firepot soup to split and again... filling. Fair price. Good food. Definitely worth a trip into downtown Glendale.

0YemXHy7re5QkFsri_npMA.text: OMG god am I glad I only live 5 minutes from here! Can I just live here and eat here everyday?!? I'm so serious this place blows my mind away!!! It's so ridiculously good! It's really intimate and when you first walk in you may think you are walking into any other hole in the wall Vietnamese joint but boy are you in for a treat! Anything you get on the menu I guarantee will be great. I highly recommend the spring rolls on the appetizer section, it looks like a condom with a bunch of veggies and shrimp and beef stuffed inside but it's amazing! Also if you have never tried pho before this is a great place to do so. I love seafood so I always get the shrimp and beef pho and it never disappoints me. Customer service is great! They are always on their toes to make sure you are pleased! This place absolutely deserves a 5 star. It's a must try!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Shaved iced
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Pho!!

xN-zut4sqLgPbaE60liu2A.text: Have wanted to try this spot for a while and was not let down. The service was friendly and prompt and the restaurant is in a cute little house, off Glendale Ave. they were super kid-friendly as well. As for the food, we did Boba smoothies (the boba was cooked perfectly), veggie pho (really delicious broth and all the wonderful accoutrements) and a vermicelli salad. Everything was so fresh and cooked beautifully. I live in Phoenix, but will definitely be back!

jInkTMsONgs31Iat-rmBWw.text: I love coming here with my friend that I introduced to Vietnamese food. The staff is always pleasant and seem to appreciate your business.   The spring rolls are our favorite to begin with. It's right up there with our obsession for the Jasmine Tea. You can't go wrong with the many exciting food choices on the menu. We could try something new every time and be satisfied with the choice.  Keep up the good work!

UPoj84gFxhVqFI7cT9MDmQ.text: The spring rolls were good and the food we ordered was A-OK.  that about sums it up.  Not the great Vietnamese food I ever had but it's hard to go wrong with fish sauce!  Service was decent, too.   We had the noodle salad and pork and beef with fried rice.  It's definitely good enough to come back and try something new on the menu!

e1ZpA3BQNMLpoUO4qxBcbQ.text: My favorite restaurant for Vietnamese food in the Valley. We eat a dish I cannot pronounce, that is char-grilled meat wrapped in grape leaves and served with rice papers, rice noodles, fish sauce, and veggies. You build them yourself. Sooooo delicious. The staff is real friendly. The restaurant is a converted home, and it is darling. Outdoor dining as well. It's the best

_9pZXlJZSZY1hT6LhKlnQA.text: I was thinking this place would be really good with all of the reviews, but I wasn't really impressed. I ordered the shrimp and steak noodle bowl. The shrimp was Ok, the steak was very chewy and a little bland. It came with a salad and some weird smellling dressing, so I skipped in the dressing. I actually liked the salad by itself and I think it had some green papya in it??? The Thai iced tea was really good though. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing? I don't know or maybe I don't like Vietnamese food? Anyway, and the customer service was mediocre so I more than likely won't be back.

KVzriB6LZy9gso1Ta4vuSw.text: This place is awesome!  You have to get the spring rolls, and wrap them in lettuce with the radishes and mint and all of the garnish that comes with it and dunk it into the sauce!  You will want to go back over and over just for these!  The food has always been really good and we love the place!

tyy1xKg-jQswKofPLdBRhQ.text: I love this place! The Vietnamese pork spring rolls and vermicelli salad...omg...best Vietnamese in Glendale

l7nV3L9Ozc2zUhFIjwSb3g.text: On a daughter's recommendation I had my first meal at this hidden gem in downtown Glendale.  The wait staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our server spoke perfect English and was very knowledgeable about the menu. The menu is huge (about 100 items- you order by number) so it can be a little confusing understanding the differences between even just the soup cboices! In the end we all ordered soups and they were very large portions but chock full of noodles and meat and a good size plate of veggies to toss in. It was a lot of food! And very good! It's a small restaurant but we didn't feel crowded at all and enjoyed our view at the window. The only down side for me was that I'm pretty sensitive to different foods etc and I got pretty bloated later in the day. I'm gonna guess it was the salt in the soup. Next time I think I'll try one of the rice plates. ..they also looked yummy.

Qy2BHK-KusUlbHCdgPDHQA.text: Our favorite Vietnamese food in AZ. The Pho is huge, flavorful, full of noodles and delishisness. The curry is perfect. The right amount of onions, carrots, potatoes and Chicken. It's so good you can drink it. The spring rolls are a favorite of my wife and they are not fried, yummy and healthy. The ambience is local and fun. A must try for those who love asian cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Spring rolls(yummy and healthy)
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Potstickers(tasty)
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Crispy Noodles and other stuff(very nice)

8niUPMWlcnP4kk0Ra38MGg.text: Had the number 13 (the vegetarian pho) and it was very yummy! I don't like that the noodles are one big bundle thrown in on the side because it was hard to take them apart but once I got them separated it was delicious.   Only two people working the front but both seemed to be very attentive and on top of keeping the customers satisfied.

ZvOswJP1pdquSpKEIl1HNQ.text: Been here twice so far and plan to return multiple more times. The place is small but the food is amazing. The jellyfish salad is very refreshing on a hot day. Haven't had anything bad yet and with only 2 visits so far we have managed to sample a lot from the menu.

7qQbQQxPy6ZwbVwXmtF5zg.text: Great place! I love their food, fresh, delicious. I drive 45 minutes just want come here for dinner. Good price and great food. Definitely top one on my list. :)

Qlin8WCzrtMKeeoFQnD2sw.text: What happened!? So disappointed. Theres been a steady decline in flavor, portion size, and missing menu items. Pho portions have been getting smaller and smaller with less protein and noodles and they never have the coconut water or banana dessert when we try to order it. If you order any dish with meat they will literally put like 3-4 slivers on your plate and pour on the veggies to make it look like more. I want my moneys worth! Pho broth is not as flavorful anymore either, seems like theyre not putting as much time into it. I dont know if its a new owner or theyre trying to cut costs but theyre one more bad dining experience away from losing us as customer forever. At least theyre spring rolls are still amazing...

Orr3Ie4LQ34eBgDxgnkU6A.text: I went in with family who visited from out of town and we were in the mood for pho. This was my second time coming in. I ordered their meatball pho and it wasn't too convincing. Usually I like to start eating pho without any added ingredients. But it clearly needed it right away. No matter how much sauce, lime, cilantro, sprouts I added I just couldn't find the flavor. I was surprised on the reviews and ratings on this place but we really didn't like it here. The customer service was great but the pho was disappointing. I will not be back.

Gsu4fl1u1HxIPrrQMfqkDw.text: This place was a fantastic find. I spend a lot of time in historic Glendale, and I have passed this restaurant many times. Finally we made our way to Little Saigon, and I couldn't be happier with the experience.  To start with, we has great service. The young lady that waited on us was friendly, knowledgable, and very helpful. She spent time explaining each dish and left me wanting to try a large part of the menu.  She never let my drinks go un-filled.  The food was fantastic! We shared the spring rolls and the sauce was excellent. The pork inside was tender and very flavorful.  I had the #14, rice noodle stew, and it was awesome. The beef was slowly cooked and very tender. It fell apart in my mouth! Very, very well made. It was so big that I had 2 meals worth of leftovers.  My boyfriend had the #48, which was breaded garlic shrimp with caramelized onions. He let me try one and, WOW! This was the best part. It was very hard to resist eating his entire meal.   Nicely done, Little Saigon.

LpQjzbxPVlhufNE9tTBLtA.text: Love this place good food good service and good atmosphere, best pho in town.  Thank you

4kgT9gRhaOFWXnCOQmR3lw.text: It's located in a really cute home garden-y place! And the food tastes like real home made Vietnamese food :-)

Uw-7ewfPyc3Ncohw7m1R6w.text: Love Love Love it here! The food is amazing, My personal favs are the Pho Tom and #23 chicken and vegetables stir fry! The location is good and the restaurant itself is very clean and authentic. Caroline & Kathy are great, they work so fast and always know what you need before you even ask. I usually order to go since I work down the street and they always have my meal warm and ready to go, but when I do dine it the service is amazing. Definitely one of my favorite places, I always recommended it to everyone!!

_wjwxgk5tsgNbVOqD-XnCA.text: I love this place! Small but charming restaurant. Food is pretty darn good! Service is good comparing to other pho places! Must give this place a try! I recommend it to everyone!

ciV1OVbKKpbSvJvjE2c5Hw.text: THE Absolute BEST PHO on the west side!  Add extra jalapenos for your hangover cure Everything is fresh and hand made in house!  We frequent quite a bit and look forward to our next visit

JRBe26hrX0sYKqBnpVzcww.text: Loved it! Everything I ate there was delicious! I ordered a couple different dishes to try it out but it was so good I ate a little more then what I wanted to.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States

J5a8qsuXoo8orLc-lnn2Uw.text: Best pho place to go for glendale area! especially with this season whoooaa what a place great location a lot pf parking area and when you go at night you'll see famous downtown glendale lights.   Very affordable and staff are very knowledgeable on their menu

dF1TyiT0Ode2X_BmlY9BTA.text: My only complaint is that they don't have Pad Thai which is one of our absolute favorite dishes ever.   I got the beef and shrimp bun. I was really hungry today and after I ate mine, I was still hungry. We didn't get appetizers though, and normally we do. The buns here don't have mint, and had less noodles than I expected. However, it was very good. The beef was perfectly cooked. The shrimp was a little over cooked but not to the point where it was bad. I enjoyed it and I will be back.   Their Thai tea is less sweet, with a stronger tea flavor but it was quite enjoyable and it was $3.   The honey got the pork and shrimp bun. I'm assuming because he inhaled it, that it was good.   My oldest got the Pho with rare beef. She ate the entire bowl. Holy pho. She said it was great. I didn't have the chance to try the broth but it smelled good.   Our youngest wanted noodles and got soft noodles with veggies and chicken. She was quiet, so that means it was delicious. This was our first time eating inside. The honey got it to go last time. The staff was nice enough and didn't talk a lot. Overall, if you don't want pad Thai, come here. It's very good.

1H9ABUhnQP3BRvjByEJtWA.text: Went here for dinner and was very satisfied with the food! My roommate and I ordered the beef and shrimp pho to share as well as the crispy flat noodle plate to share. Their dishes are big enough to share so that was a plus! It does get a little busy at night so it's best to kinda have an idea of what you want to eat before larger parties because your food will be backed up, but they had speedy friendly service.

mbHU13t7JszRiMwtPP0oTg.text: We were sent here by a friend who said this place has the best Vietnamese food she's ever had in the US. We were not disappointed! Everything was delicious and the staff was so nice. Would definitely recommend the Pork Vermicelli bowl, the Beef Salad and the Catfish.

3zZaG6kK3pnYV5C9XlKMug.text: Wow I'm so sad to do this review as I have been coming here for years and years. Sadly today I was not impressed. We ordered spring rolls and the meat that was inside was really hard like it was old meat, then we get our dishes I ordered a won ton soup my husband had a beef and potatoes pho, talk about completely being flavorless I mean nothing at all just like water. Our service wasn't good either. So disappointed especially since this isn't too close to where I live.

naVGJVdcyMDfo_6zNXaikg.text: Okay, if you read my other reviews, you'll see that I'm pretty gung ho for Noodle dishes and nothing winds me up like a great pho or ramen joint.  Hey, West Valley:  you scored with this awesome bungalow of Vietnamese goodness.  Extensive menu of soups, salads, entrees and lots of seafood options.  I had #3 potstickers and they're the real deal, house made and golly they're good.  #9 pho was amazing with a heaping pile of super fresh sprouts, basil, cilantro, peppers and limes to add in to suit your taste.  Chicken pho was tasty too.  Our companion enjoyed #31 Vietnamese chicken bowl and thought it was outstanding.

c6MfprNx8Rrrp9vu6d6_KQ.text: I am writing this review because I have no tolerance for rude people.  We are big foodies and wanted to try this place out.  We got seated pretty quickly.  I asked our server if they add extra MSG to the food (as most Asian restaurants do).  Her response was "how would I know I am not in the kitchen".  Wow! And she continued to "lecture" me that MSG is naturally in soy sauce and other sauces.  Needless to say, she was rushed and rude throughout.  The place is small and there were probably 5 tables and one server.  Most tables aside from us(3 adults) had 2 people.

ZX94HVjFT0ECjNmlCyom5Q.text: One of our favorite places to go to in Glendale! The Pho is the best in town, and the veggie egg roles are to die for! I love this place because it's authentic, has great customer service and always has the freshest Vietnamese in town! I also opt in for the Snoh dessert- we like the strawberry snoh with fresh mango and condensed milk THE BOMB! I suggest this place for the best viet in town!

uPLWVrVh04w9MXESox1J2g.text: Great tasting tofu!! Ordered the Vegetarian Pho (substituted chicken broth for veggie broth), stir fry vegetarian and vegetable egg rolls... wow amazing flavor and I've had a cold and the pho was great in help clearing me up  not to spicy and just right. I LOVE this place and will be back.

zVn_48HOkP1NtHaX5zcMyA.text: I can't believe I grew up in Glendale and never heard of this place! I'm so glad somebody told me it was there. Cute Place tucked away in the heart of Glendale with a traditional Vietnamese menu. I love the hot pot soups especially when I'm feeling under the weather.

EY73SVO4g3Q1VewC4PhTbQ.text: They said lunch served until 2:30 pm We got there 1:59pm exactly  There was door sign said "closed, comeback at 5:00" Even on Yelp said they will close in 30min at the point at we arrived!!  They need to be exact on their business hour. We just wasted 20min of driving time plus gas, we could've gone to somewhere else if the business hour was clear!

HQY6MJwt2VKKkk5IccwhfQ.text: Coming to Arizona twice from California, we have tried many eateries in this  Phoenix surroundings.  Tonight our family of five decided to eat at Little Saigon and it was a total surprise.  We ordered the traditional Vietnamese food like Lau ca Chua and Banh Hoi.  They were surprisingly delicious.  I tried these foods in so many places in Santa Anna, San Jose, San Francisco and so on but this is my best so far.  From friendly staff, reasonable pricing and the quality of foods, I agreed with the five stars their diners gave them, the write ups from independent publications and the Yelps.

2ApOSXXAOgQqsO6TenPWdg.text: Had the mi quang yesterday and it was very filling and delicious!  It comes with pork, chicken and shrimp and a light broth and side of veggies! So good!   Downside is kinda pricey but worth it and I ordered the egg rolls but for six dollars you get these mini egg rolls not very appetizing but over all will be coming back.

P8E6UXtIO-pUH68TXxOV8g.text: What a find during my ongoing Vietnamese food trip - a Vietnamese restaurant which, unlike the others I've been to, is located in a charming converted little home rather than in a run down strip mall.  But the food is just as good or better, and with run-down-strip-mall-eatery prices. Their banh xeo (crispy rice crepes stuffed with beansprouts and shrimp) is awesome, and the generous seafood soup with white asparagus is something I'd order even on a hot day.  One of my favorite Vietnamese dishes is rice vermicelli with shrimp and pork or beef, and while their version is not as bold in flavor as Dong A's, it is definitely quite tasty. The courteous service complements the brevity of the wait between placing your order and receiving your food.

V01c6BIYZ1j6BCEE1xHGNA.text: Placed an order for pickup within 30 seconds of being on the phone. Food was delicious, we got #21 and #20 and couldn't tell which we liked better both were fantastic. Only complaint is that I didn't get any stuffed shrimp with my #20 and #21 only came with 2 pieces of shrimp.   I would come back, but I'm def going to explore other Pho options in the area first. I give the food itself a 5 star review but not receiving something I paid for is fairly upsetting.

Hy2y7K_sLarXBK1EdUySjA.text: It's hard to spot on the first drive by, but it's an absolutely lovely looking place. Small, but comfy to those who don't prefer higher-end luxuries. The food selection is great, and from what we've ordered: Each were delicious and of great quality. The prices were affordable, and that's a great plus considering the quality! Most of my attention went to their desserts. The fried banana with ice cream was wonderful~! Definitely recommend!  The only reason why I give it a 4-star instead of a 5-star, is that the quality of the food I've had (cubed steak cuts and stirfry beef), while great, isn't astounding in their flavors - I've had similar in other restaurants, and I've had better in rare other restaurants. Perhaps I should order more foods to see if they stand out in some items more than others. Perhaps next time I'll order an item they're well known for. By no means should you think a 4-star is a bad or unspectacular rating. It's an excellent restaurant for everything it advertises itself to be.

ZI7zYbJtpoMJ-73KVuQT0Q.text: I am an avid fan of Vietnamese Rice Noodle... I can eat this noodle soup everyday! At least once a week or more, I go to Pho602, or the one near in Bethany Home Rd. and 43rd Ave. in Phoenix. Being said so... I am very familiar how it should look like, and what are the stuff I should expect in my Vietnamese Rice Noodle. My wife and I decided to eat in LITTLE SAIGON in Down Town Glendale, AZ for a Rice Noodle and Fried Noodle. PROS: 1. The place is clean. 2. The servers are very welcoming. 3. Quick Service.  CONS: 1. The first thing that you will see in the entrance is the FILTY AQUARIUM that if you look into it, you will lose your appetite right away... (Too bad, I love aquariums and I know the difference between clean and filthy aquarium)  2. I was expecting a lot in my Rice Noodle bowl since it is more expensive than Pho602. It was $9, so this young lady bringing it from the kitchen, from a far I was so happy because it was HUGE BOWL, but when she put it in the table, IT CONTENTS ONLY HALF OF THE BOWL! NO TRIPE, MEATBALLS ONLY 2 PIEACES, RICE NOODLE NOT ENOUGH, BEEF SMALL AMOUNT COMPARED TO Pho602 and the one near Bethany and 43rd Ave. When you order XL it is really XL and you can expect so much stuff inside your bowl! Tripe, beef meat, beef ligament, lots of noodle to enjoy for only $7.50!  3. My wife ordered fried noodle and it was $10, so I was expecting something really good, like amount wife and ingredients will be more. But unfortunately, IT WAS TOO DRY, THEY JUST BASICALLY PUT LOTS OF VEGETABLE, NOT THAT MUCH OF MEAT.  IF YOU WANT TO GET A QUALITY VIETNAMESE FOOD FOR THE PRICE YOU ARE WILLING TO PAY FOR, SAVE YOUR SELF FROM THIS PLACE AND DRIVE FEW MILES AND GO TO PHO 602 or the one near Bethany Home Village and 43rd Ave.

Y9umvzPXSwG_6fi7wyA_wQ.text: So much variety on the menu in terms of traditional Vietnamese dishes. The bo lac loc portion was very small. It came with one scope of rice with about 8pieces of beef. I do not recommend. PxDcVNCkkm27xkLHUE4siw.text: Once upon a time, I was a big fan of Little Saigon.   And then my girlfriend and I started trying other Vietnamese Restaurants and have kind of forgotten about them over the years. Honestly, I wasn't quite sure just precisely why we had forgotten, until a recent refresher visit helped to remind me.  The menu is what you'd typically expect, which is always a bit overwhelming and confusing if you're not familiar with this style of food. I've always found that Vietnamese restaurants are the type where I'm very happy that Yelp pictures are available to give you an idea of what you're getting into.  During our recent visit, my fried rice dish just tasted off, having this weird, funky flavor that I can only describe as being like a greasy and dirty grill. My girlfriend's chicken slab was tough, difficult to cut, and just simply not very good in comparison to what we're used to. Maybe it was an off night in the kitchen? I recall the food being much better. I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt and maintain that if it's a good night, you'll be pleased.  For desserts, they offer a fried banana that comes with some vanilla ice cream. It can range from very good to just okay, depending on whether the ice cream is at the "freezer burn" stage or not. They also offer snoh, but given its current popularity and comparing it to other places, we were quite disappointed, mainly due to the incredibly stale mochi balls.  Okay, so maybe I'm being a little too hard on them. Vietnamese cuisine has picked up a bit in recent years in Phoenix, which probably factors a bit into my overall rating.  It's (usually) good based on many of our past experiences - but you can definitely do better if you know where to look.

qxE7dRjKRvfQFMp1_vjdGQ.text: It has been quite a while since visiting here, my wife ordered the stir fried shrimp and rice. I ordered the beef, broccoli and carrots served with steamed rice. My wife commented that the shrimp had no flavor with some being tender and some being very hard. The fried rice served with this dish was at least good.  My dish was alas also very lackluster. The broccoli was undercooked very hard as were the carrots. How can you undercook carrots that are sliced an eighth of an inch thick? I tried cutting off the stems of the broccoli but even the florets were tough. The saving grace was the beef. It was very tender and the sauce was good, combined with the steamed rice (which was well cooked) saved this from being a one star review. I might go back to try some of the Pho dishes which seem to receive  some good reviews. Though it  will be some time before we return. I don't know how to post pictures to show all of the broccoli stems I cut off to try to at least eat the florets.

Q7jNdIebePxmAnMoyp31nA.text: Today I found a slice of heaven in Old Town Glendale. I had an appointment just a block away and was so excited to try this place. Parking was right on the street out front and so simple to find. Located in an old home it fit right in with all the awesome spots in the neighborhood. I got there right at opening and was greeted with a smile right away and able to chose my table. There were already quite a few people ordering inside. There are tables  in two different large rooms inside as well as some sitting room outside. It was a bit too cold for me so I opted for a table inside. I ordered some water while I looked over the menu and quickly saw they had a taro smoothie with boba and instantly knew I had to try it. So glad  I did because it was amazing! The flavor was spot on . I decided on the pho ga or chicken pho if you're unaware of what pho ga is. I was a bit bummed because I wanted to try some egg rolls, but was told they only come in a order of six rolls. You can get two spring rolls, but if you're looking for egg rolls bring a friend or a big appetite. There's always next time. My food came out quickly and the bowl was HUGE! It had so much flavor! Tons of fresh veggies and they definitely did not scrimp on the chicken either. There were plenty of chopsticks and sauces on the table so I did not have to ask for anything. My waitress was very attentive and more and more people were piling in by the second. It was so great to see how many regulars they seem to have as well as how full they were on a Monday this early in the day. I enjoyed my lunch and never felt rushed. There were so many delicious dishes coming out and o can't wait to try them all. The restaurant was very clean and everyone worked great as a team. My only wish is hopefully one day maybe there is an option for a smaller order of egg rolls when dining alone. I will definitely be back with friends.

_Od4BkZFqZoyh5XkfNdp9Q.text: Such a quaint and delicious restaurant! Everything we ordered was amazing- pho, fried catfish, veggie springs rolls and thai boba iced tea were amazing! Plenty of dish options for vegetarians like myself. But of course I had to get pho and the broth for the vegetarian pho was so flavorful! Hubby and I will definitely will be back!

_NgVw54UwwTXuHPv9EGAZA.text: Great place to eat fresh food and relax.The Curry,Spring Rolls, Pot-Stickers and Vermicelli noodles and pork is outstanding .We have been customers for 11 years now

C0vtCEsJA5Plfh6Ly7gMoQ.text: I've been coming here for six years. I usually get the pho or the fried rice combination plate. My wife and I went this past weekend and we ordered the usual. As my wife was eating her pho, she noticed a worm on her spoon. It was very unappetizing and we immediately stopped eating. To give Saigon the benefit of the doubt, they do provide fresh herbs, so I understand this happens, but it was still gross to see.   I would still strongly recommend this place, just double check your spoon to ensure you are not eating tiny critters!

7MUFVeaNj_OzFdbc1eUBrA.text: A great restaurant to visit if you are in the Glendale area. I ordered the spring rolls and chicken pho- which were both to die for. And there were many other items on the menu I would have loved to try if I were in the area any longer. If you're interested in having something a little bit different for dinner, check out little Saigon!

z7EdbXT4R4pwLyRwCswZDw.text: Wonderful little place. I absolutely love the outdoor courtyard and the quaint little establishment inside. The waiter was very patient and likeable and the service was quick. Food was spectacular and there was a lot of people coming in to have lunch. (:

a5CB_kizwtKe9mDde8Jcpg.text: By far the best Vietnamese restaurant In Phoenix. We ordered the fried  vegetarian egg roll. Omg is all I can say. The pho soup is the best and very addictive so expect to go back for more.  My daughter in law got the pork chops and rice. Her favorite.  All ingredients are fresh and colorful and the presentation of your order shows they take pride in what they are preparing. The service is second to no one. They are all very attentive and appreciate you being there. I would recommend if you haven't tried it then you need to. You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Fried vegetable egg rolls. The portion is bigger than pictured We couldn&#39;t resist before taking picture.

Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Pho soup  yum!!!

5owIKoXuJrKqi7zc91WR6w.text: This is my absolute favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Glendale.  Their Pho is amazing.  The vermicelli with check and egg roles is a personal favorite also.  Service is always good but anything around Noon and you'll be waiting a bit for lunch as they tend to get busy.  This is by my work and I try to go at least a few times a month.  It's worth the drive from wherever you are at in the valley!

p_pTlLqX1Y3aJVsVj9ZJVQ.text: I always love coming to Little Saigon! The food is always fresh and delicious! The staff is always friendly and helpful! I am working through the menu, and so far #81 and the fried bananas are my favorites!! It is always clean, and the best part is that it is family run. It is located in downtown Glendale, so after a phenomenal meal, you can always walk it off afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. This is a cat fish dish that I tried today for the first time....I love it!

fSQ7cNbbQE-_YBltOfGd-g.text: Just ok. The broth was tasteless and the meat in the bowl was scarce and way over priced. The staff did not carry a professional or friendly demeanor. We are now lifers at Phoenix Pho.

WM7HeE4F4_N-WblKFXgbQA.text: This place is so damn delicious! By far best Vietnamese place to eat and customer service is also great!   I've been eating vegetarian for over a month and every time I eat there I get the veggie egg rolls, spinach with garlic sauce, and there lemon grass tofu that normally comes with chicken but obviously leave the chicken out... And OMG! #foodorgasm! Lol.. AMAZING!

QCtlc3CG9_kXewK9rTALWA.text: I give them a two star because the attending lady was rude, we went there yesterday for lunch hour and we were waiting to be seated for at least 15 minutes which in some other places you only wait at least 4 minutes! I wrote our names on the waiting list because I didn't know if they needed a certain name or multiple names to put on the wait list! The lady was yelling out our names and she then said is this a group and I said yes, and she hesitated and said you don't have to do that, but the way she said it she said it like if she was bothered! We waited for another 15 minutes and then she came and we said we are in a bit of a hurry, then she said "it's not gonna happen!" And we decided to leave!

rJhBtTlz4DTfMuAKL58O9g.text: This place has pretty good pho in Glendale glitters! If you're downtown Glendale if you're looking to get some soup this is a good place to pop into. I do recommend them  I give them 1 thumb up. The only thing I didn't like about them was that they did not give enough  beef. So if you do order from this place they give below average on the beef so you might want to ask them for extra

el6mWiq-CYZY9K66b2GjyQ.text: Always come here the food is good the service is great! Cathy the server is always so nice and helpful! The beef pho and the spring rolls are my favorite !

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States

ncEFy8E53BCZdTPF3V5CxQ.text: Little Saigon in Glendale?  Holy Cow this place was fantastic. My family and I came here for lunch , and we had their Pho tai and it was delicious ! And the smelled was awesome, the classic pho soup with all the veggies. The taste was so good, it brought me back when I was Seattle visiting my son . We also experience for the first time Goi Cuon spring rolls with shrimp they were simply amazing .I almost forgot we order the Banh Xep pan fried potstickers with sauce they were so yummy .Yeah for finally finding a good authentic Vietnamese place. I miss my Vietnamese food and Yeah that I don't have to drive far to get it. Approximately  mile 1/2 away from me. I can't wait go there again ...

rgRhb9Z8fkpYCIs8bPmvaw.text: Excellent food and service.  Cute little place in town, well worth it.  We are very picky when it comes to restaurants and we were quite pleased with this experience.    Definitely a 'locals' hidden gem and not touristy...we are from Vancouver, Canada and we like to find locals secrets :)

SZv3gO3miWHixpArpRQ-TA.text: I love this place!!! The outside is nice and romantic full of lights and an overall great loose vibe. The food is awesome too and the prices aren't too bad. I will definitely come back and bring friends!

HT6IykYB3IljUwaf0lsZkw.text: Best pho in town. Best spring roll. Good food. Good prices. Highly recommended. Sometimes there can a wait but well worth it. Good thai tea. we have been going here for many years. taste is consistent. we will keep on coming back.

2ZYHzbOswGyQ7MGMywJt8Q.text: Super service, yummy food - you have to save room for the fried bananas...wow!

NlaFfQM6QEQpd5mafkLCdA.text: Legit Vietnamese food. My husband is a culinary student and we go to a lot of Vietnamese restaurants because it is his favorite genre of food. This is authentic food that is simply delicious. Cute little place in downtown Glendale so feel free to do some antique shopping on foot when you are done.

7JUwo_rARvrn3tEoIqI-9A.text: First time eating there yesterday and the food was delicious, the service was great, and the overall atmosphere is very nice and warm. I recommend this place!!~

2_vLzRTJ7412Jkk1mVEvfg.text: AUTHENTIC!! Travel from Little Taipei, California,  I'm glad that I found this place to satisfy my Asian food cravings. Very solid and decent place.

VbmO5YKF4lU4nz9pM_gIYg.text: Vietnamese food in Glendale?  Holy Crap this place was fantastic.  Its set in this little ol house on Glendale and 57th ave in what appears to be a local hangout  Whats cool is that this place must have a huge following because the waiter new half the people in the restaurant.   The place is small on the inside it has two rooms.  We were in the first one as you walked in which had seating for about 20+ people it was pleasantly decorated and the beer and wine was clearly visible from our table.  They serve house wine and beer.  And yes you can get Vietnamese beer here.    We started our meal with the appetizer crepes.  The crepes were filled with yummy shrimp pork and rice noodles.  Our waiter showed us how to eat these as they come with lettuce leaves that you are supposed to wrap the crepe in add some veggies and dip in oil.  Messy But FUN!  and so so tasty.  The crepe was light and so were the fillings.  Don't be intimidated by the size of the appetizer which is monstrous because if you share its enough.    For my dinner I had the dumpling soup.  Which was just awesome.  The broth is fantastic.  The egg noodles perfect and the garnish was absolutely awesome.  It comes with mint leaves, bean sprouts and lemon.  My girl had the mix rice bowl with chicken,pork, and egg rolls.  Hers was so mouth watering and she had so much we took the other half home and had a midnight snack!  Now I haven't had Vietnamese food in forever and I was over joyed by the friendliness and comfort of this place.  We will be back.  I would recommend this for anyone wanted to try something that is a little different but very tasty.  You will be glad you did!  Lastly I dont know what this is a two cash sign price range.  For two dinners an appetizer and two glasses of wine we paid 26 bucks.

DXe5zJHnYUAjkdnK2TDLmg.text: I love this locally owned restaurant.  The service has always every single time been excellent and friendly.  The rice flour crepes are spectacular, the chicken pho soup is a must.  We eat there at least once a month.  And any other dish we have gotten has been very flavorful and yummy.  We call in for take out and the food is still perfect and delicious after the drive home.  Lots of veggies to go with the rice flour crepe and the pho soup.  It's one of our favorites and consistently never disappoints us.

o1gzJ4hABkWHgif7_gUALw.text: Me and my date wanted to try a new restaurant and decided on Little Saigon... The appetizer was yummy, we had the vegetarian spring rolls. We ordered our food.. and the first couple of bites were good, but then I noticed a giant cockroach crawling down the wall behind my date! Needless to say we didn't finish...

hc0nuWRnS-Wfa9J29mwMKQ.text: I had the experience of my employer ordering from Little Saigon for a luncheon we had scheduled.Never having had Vietnamese food I was weary but that changed. The spring rolls and soup were SO GOOD and so filling!! Look forward to trying more goodies from here in the near future.

KKrnD5sc-_Ff_H4bZEKM3Q.text: This is hands-down my favorite restaurant in Glendale. Very cute, family-run restaurant in downtown Glendale. They have the best Vietnamese spring rolls--roast pork, shrimp, vermicelli, cilantro wrapped in delicate rice paper and dipped into a peanut sauce.   The pho is great--Asian comfort food. Catfish is also good. Just had the seafood won ton noodle soup last night and didn't like the wontons, but the broth was very nice and light.   Very reasonable prices and friendly service. I take all of the friends I like to this place.

ePsPRMKEGOGbN8m1gPz1KA.text: Love it here I am totally adicteeeddd to PHO I like eating  here and after walk around downtown Glendale ..the part that I like more is the ambience family own and is like a little secret

dF-yI6wN79eXMuhQnRkvkw.text: After a fairly miserable first experience at Little Saigon, I was hesitant to go back, but because I know so many people who hold it in such high regard, I've been back several times. It grows on me a little bit every time and I realized that ever since I haven't seen the bad server I had the first time, I've really liked it!  They do fantastic spring rolls, with a tasty peanut sauce and the presentation is much nicer than usual. Bun Cha and Pho Tai are two dishes I've had there multiple times and was really impressed. Cold, fresh veggies, quality ingredients, and great taste.   This is a family run business and it really shows with the pride they take in getting to know their customers, and efficient friendly service. The restaurant, being in a home, has a certain charm that I'm used to downtown and really appreciate. This isn't my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in town, but it's up there with the best. I wish their prices weren't so high. They are at least a dollar more per item than anyone else.

wIu8g47pzUJ3geaA5wtBlA.text: Yummy. The family stopped by furring vacation. Good stuff.

w2ZJlNICVdfnL6cDPMQakw.text: Little Saigon is in our top 5 restaurants here in Arizona. My husband and I love this place. First of all, it's in a fun bungalow style house in old Glendale which just adds to its charm. Second, the family that runs it is awesome. You'll be greeted by Tony or Hui (not sure how to spell it) or John and they're all great people. They know us by now and we're always greeted like old friends. I've tried half the items on the menu, which is extensive and haven't found anything I don't like. My husband is usually stuck on #35 or #36 which are their rice noodle dishes. So good. We've introduced our friends to Little Saigon and I have one friend who will gladly drive from East Scottsdale just for the fried banana/ice cream dessert (which is a MUST, by the way). In all, I will always recommend this restaurant!

TIw76Kld8iY0n9lDWjp5gg.text: Downtown Glenedale, who knew?! An adorable cottage houses the best Vietnamese restaurant in North Phoenix, if not all of Phoenix! Family owned and run, you feel more and more like part of the family with each visit. They have a foundation of loyal customers built on word of mouth.  An extensive menu of usual  Vietnamese dishes. and though they have fab pho, my favorite dish is the barbecued fish (off the menu)- hand delivered on a steaming platter by Dad himself! One of these is enough for 2. Wash it down with a '33' beer and take a leisurely stroll through downtown Glendale.

TIYwzyWRcoVlt3M2olEDpw.text: this was a pleasant little discovery we made. we'll be going back for sure! the ambiance was that of a busy place, food was great, (if you knew what to order) service wasn't too annoying like the other oriental places.

3N2AH3JgWvabRi-DjCqPwA.text: I have frequented this restaurant for over 20 years (incl. past locations).  The food is the best in the area and surpasses that I've had in the many cities I've visited.   Every friend I send to this restaurant go back; I recommend you try it too.   Soup is great, so is the lemongrass chicken, seasoned flank steak, and salads. Top off you meal with a tasty iced coffee--but not too late in the day if caffeine keeps you awake!

KIf-DPzAKA6uWgWFFWyPrQ.text: Great food and friendly staff if you go on the days when the owners are present.  Wish they had consistency in their food/service, but when someone other than the owners are running the joint, watch out for missing soup parts (shrimp, fish balls, etc.)   Their lemongrass soups are WONDERFUL!  And you don't want to miss their hot pots.  Yummy

qIXJ5V3aKCbwSNWtPh_Hkw.text: after reading the reviews on here, decided to give it a try....  Started off with the spring rolls and then got the combo fried rice(w pork, beef, chicken and shrimp), gotta say I was very impress with all the flavors that came out those dishes, added a little spice and everything was nice.  The service was good, very attentive and will help you out with their expansive menu.  Gonna visit again soon.

qxZbOGojeOOLAhsHbhC9AA.text: My favorite restaurant! The staff is friendly and they make you feel like you are at home. I take people who have never been and they fall in love with the place everytime.

_ovbW6i_iq3S1vzYxgMU6Q.text: Had high hopes based on reviews, cute setting, but terrible service and garish lighting. The chicken pho was good, the steamed catfish was good, but extremely fishy, so if that's a problem you, beware. The waitress was abrupt, then ignored us, brought the food but no utensils, brought the bill without asking if we wanted anything else, never asked how our food was. Never made eye contact. Won't be back.

7Dn7pUMzZg0ptEDirI1WDw.text: Poor service! 3 dined, 2 served and 1 forgotten. Said, "Sometimes you all can't eat together, we are busy!" Wouldn't comp meal had to take mine to-go.  :(

B7ZabIgPOOs0GDi0trrE1w.text: The food was great. I went on a Friday at lunchtime and the place was full. I had to wait about 10 minutes. It was totally worth it. I had the potstickers which were great. They tasted like they were made in house. I also had #23. h tiu xao thp cm / flat rice noodles with beef, pork, chicken & vegetables. It was similar to chow fun if you have had that before. The flavor was very good. The meat was tasty and all the veggies were fresh and crisp. The noodles were just right. Everything was well balanced. I have had the pho and spring rolls before and they were great as well. If you like asian food you should add Little Saigon into your rotation. It provides different flavors than Grand Dragon or Siamese Kitchen the Chinese and Thai restaurants I love on the west side. I can't wait to go back and try some other items.

FVhqX9iiveg3bGchmWWFfA.text: Wonderful Vietnamese food. I just ordered some take out for me and a co-worker, our first try of this little restaurant. I ordered the Ga Xao Xa Ot, which was so rich and full of flavor. When I picked up our food, the restaurant was packed with a waiting list at 11:30, obviously a very popular place to dine for lunch. I will definitely go back to try other dishes.

Az-jZ6IDi0REdqqeYidEMg.text: Phenomenal meal as always. We have a number of good Vietnamese restaurants in Philadelphia, but we don't have a Little Saigon. Make sure you don't miss this gem.

7v350hcOGnsm38XkOFRroA.text: Stopped by for the first time today. I'll be back! Started with the hot jasmine tea. Then the pot stickers which were piping hot and really flavorful, we wound up getting a second order they were so good .  My entree was number 26 pan fried flat rice noodles with beef pork and chicken . I added shrimp for $2 more.  The brown sauce was really tasty and the veggies were crisp and perfect .

rh_OuupWOo0lCjapPyFIWA.text: We visit during the lunch hour and a absolutely love any and everything they make, the veggies are nice and fresh and always crunchy.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Come on in.

hR-OIuLRD7rf5ot8p4xZ4Q.text: I love Little Saigon! I've been going since before I had my son and he just turned five years old last month. Everyone is very friendly, the food is always amazing and I always look forward to eating here! I use to live around the corner so I'd just walk over but moved and make the almost hour drive to eat here! Love love love!

A59wAYvl8PlFMuM4BQaV7Q.text: Great local Vietnamese cuisine! The service was awesome and the food was amazing. Of course, you have to try the pho!

XiCipsBaDXIUbsjY7wGKqw.text: When I came in I was instantly pleased by the "fish are friends not food" sign on their aquarium. I knew this was a good sign. The patio option was closed when we were there.  I like the price and food selection ranging from pho to noodles to shark fin soup (I must try it!). With so vast a selection, I find it hard to be on point with all dishes.   I asked for a recommendation and ordered what looked like the easiest dish to make. A thin slice of pork and beef, fried rice, and a side salad. The most intriguing was the salad with delicious lightly pickled vegetables acting as a dressing. I thought the fired rice was rather bland and greatly benefited from a healthy dose of soy sauce (WARNING: not fish sauce is in smaller sized soy sauce bottle). I also tried the potstickers (highlight dipping sauce), shrimp noodle dish, and spicy chicken rice dish our company ordered. All solidly good, nothing remarkable.

x4W7KpoG4XnrVWAl8Oc4Yg.text: I was bummed that they did not have Bahn Mi sandwiches. I had my heart set on that so I decided to split a plate of the stir fried flat noodles with chicken. My biggest mistake was not ordering my own plate. This dish was delicious, far exceeded my expectations! My hot pot soup with tofu was also really, really good. I definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting Asian food in the Glendale area. Nice mom and pop restaurant with real Vietnamese cuisine.

Ewk_6I2EK5gjdd2agF-vhQ.text: I've never been disappointed with anything I've ever ordered from there. Everything is delicious, especially  their soups and shave ice cream. The staff is really nice as well.

6FwRef2I97RyU0xAwxfMew.text: The only reason I gave this place 4 stars is because they messed up my to go order once and tried to make me pay for their error. Love this place and love introducing people to this place. From the spring rolls to the Pho it is awesome. Everything is delicious and the atmosphere is cozy.

FG9UAiCORfJtpkNwm3Y27w.text: I've dined here 3 or 4 times for lunch and have enjoyed each meal.  Their menu has a "Vegetable Entrees" section with a nice list of options.  So far, I've had the veggie spring rolls (yum), stir-fry tofu (yum), and the coconut curry (double yum!).  The employees are very happy to answer any menu questions I've had about dairy, fish sauce, and other non-veg ingredients.  The entree sizes are quite generous, and the staff is so attentive.  Our glasses were filled each time they got about half-way empty.  Every server walking by asked us if we wanted more rice.  And when I got a to-go box, our server offered me extra rice -- how nice!  I work in downtown Glendale and appreciate a great local restaurant that's good for vegetarians and vegans (there are so few down there).  I'll definitely keep going back.

TxX-Hq3Pf1kXjyPG64ufOA.text: What a little Asian gem among these parts. I didn't have much of a chance to try different pho joints back in Illinois, and I imagine there aren't too many here. But nonetheless, Little Saigon has great pho. We had the beef pho; broth was flavorful, and the option to put in as many or little veggies as you want was nice. My boyfriend said the combination fried rice was possibly the best he ever had. We had enough leftovers for two more meals.

BkuRj2zdVFsKnd9QZTLYlg.text: The food here is so darn good!! I love the spring rolls and their authentic menu. Great service,  they truly make you feel like family.

IYQXX9vAdIHM0L7XPt27og.text: I have tried 5 different Vietnamese restaurants in the recent past.  This one stands out in my mind as the best of them.  And none of them had any reason not to go back.  For one thing the setting in the old house is great.  And it has a shaded patio out front.  I had a chicken dish with rice which came to my table still at a full boil.  I would have liked to try the egg rolls but 6 in an order would have been a full meal in itself.  The party next to me had an order of spring rolls and egg rolls and their comments were good.  I went in the middle of lunch on a Friday and it was almost at capacity but I was seated right away and there was some delay (maybe 5 minutes) in taking my order but the food came out in a normal time.  As in many Asian restaurants it is a family operation with the son of the owners being my waiter.  Being just over a mile from work I will be back again.    Parking in downtown Glendale can be a hassle at times, less than a block away on the NE corner of 57th Ave. and Glenn Dr is a lot that only gets full during special events. In fact the downtown area is small enough I would park there to go almost anywhere in the area, but I don't mind walking.

i_RrerLg9Ik86T-UcMAdsg.text: 4.5 Star Food, 3 Star Portion size, 2 Star Service.  I've had the vermicelli salad and the fried rice, and the spring rolls.  All were typical Vietnamese fashioned food.  The wait staff, one guy and one girl is constantly busy and curt, and only basically just want to turn their tables, so if you go in asking questions don't expect any good answers or suggestions.  Size of dishes is smaller than other places, at least the vermicelli salad was, although it tastes great, as does the fried rice.

iT-J7HkwNH6URULB7vbLrQ.text: I've eaten here so many times and it's so good. Tried many Pho place this is also the best.

nPQcA2lumK2B5BBkfC9VTg.text: You can't go wrong here. I've tried almost everything on their menu and I've never been disappointed. I love coming here. I recommend the spring rolls, they are probably the best in town!! (In my opinion anyways) I love their vermicelli and pho too! Their staff are very friendly and always helpful.

qLWItXrzqFacC5VQDSHpQw.text: This place have the best pho in town. The vercemili salad is one of a kind. Staff is great and good atsmosphete. I recommend anything you will like to try.

ny58FuI8sWhBjD4D26OFIg.text: Little Saigon is a small restaurant in Glendale hidden north of Glendale ave on 57th avenue. Lets begin with cleanliness; floors were spotless and the restroom was very clean. The waitress was very friendly and took the time to explain the menu which was both in english and vietnamese.    I ordered the number 37 which is a pork and beef dinner with fried rice and  small salad. The plate was amazing and delivered promptly. Food was fresh and delicious.  A home run thx

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Number 37. Very good!
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Inside the restaurant

EkjnuZqHmr5Kpj4Vtcnwgg.text: What a great little find. Charming restaurant in a cute neighborhood. From the outside it reminded us of coffee shops that we've visited in Saigon. Inside it's just as charming, as it appears to be an old house turned into a restaurant.  A couple things threw us off - wait to be seated, but put your name on the clipboard. Second - large fish in the fish tank that reads "These fish are our friends, not food"  Anyway on to the menu - great selection of various dishes. Prices are a $1 or $2 more than other Vietnamese places we've tried to far in Phoenix - I'll give that to the area. My wife had a grilled chicken and rice dish, which she absolutely loved. Dark thigh meat chicken (it's flavorful and moist - no chicken breast here) and a lot of it. Standard rice, tomato and cucumber with fish sauce.   I chose to have an egg noodle soup (mi sui co #20) with sliced pork, pork belly (small cubes of pork belly I believe), wontons and ground pork. Also had bok choy. Great flavorful broth that really hit the spot.   Staff was friendly if not a little overwhelmed - place was busy but not slammed and the two younger people working the tables seemed like they were struggling to keep up. We still felt well attended to. Five stars all the way for great food, great ambiance and fair prices. Will be going back before we leave town.

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Mi sui cao #22 oh so good

54zGuVO5Iz0CZmUYQknoeg.text: Definitely clean and very nice servers.  Adorable little restaurant.  The food, like packaged Vietnamese food.. Egg roll tastes like Costco frozen.  I asked for my pho to be extra spicy and was told to use one of the grocery store bottles of sauce.  I asked again when the food came and she brought me a couple of Thai peppers.  Chicken noodle soup with a couple gristle pieces of meat.  My husband got sweet and sour catfish.  Nice portion but tasted like trader Joe's frozen.  Great prices...

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Pho
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Sweet sour cat fish
Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Egg roll

3V_w_2Zcpsto0Z2pL0OmFg.text: This is a hidden gem! It one of those restaurants where is hard to be honest and say how great they are because you know if anyone finds out, it will be packed! The pho here was amazing, next time I will be trying another option on the menu.

OLtRWx70a6Qu0YjEGem-aQ.text: This place was recommended by my colleague. And it was not disappointing. The pho had good portion and they were not greedy with the meat. Service was great as well. Strongly recommend their spring rolls, tons of ingredients and well worth it.

KVHfohxMq9VeLp_k4o9FsQ.text: Me and family absolutely love this place, they are always super nice and keep up with us their service is outstanding

gYAo8wNrJgv5B5S6Zj61jA.text: We went for Pho and it was delicious!  The various cuts of meat tasted fresh and freshly cooked.  The rice noodles were also delicious and they warmed up just right.  We had the fried spring rolls and those were a tad bit on the small side but we could tell they were also fresh.   This place is usually packed on the weekends but if you go during the week, you get seated right away.  Our server was nice and pleasant...she checked on us with perfect timing to refill our drinks.   Highly recommend this place for Pho lovers!

Jn61g463UZAM4nBMWKvSUQ.text: This place was a pleasant discovery made via Yelp. Sort of a treasure in the seemingly deserted downtown Glendale, this place must've been a home at one time and is now a cool little spot with some amazing Vietnamese food. The boba tea smoothie (taro) is one of the best I've come across in the valley. Our group was very satisfied after our first visit and we all agreed that we'll be returning again.

behxOxnbtG93dNRT9YD2dw.text: This is the first Vietnamese restaurant I have eaten pho at. I have tried other Vietnamese places but none compare to this restaurant. I remember as a child they used to be located inside a mall. All the food on the menu is amazing. I've tried all their spring rolls, soups, noodle dishes, and desserts. I hope this place never shuts down its my favorite place to eat good Vietnamese food. However, will say that their customer service isn't that great at times. They are usually busy whenever I come in to eat. I usually order everything right when I sit down so we don't have to wait a long time for the waitress/waiter to come back around. I have eaten there so many times I know the whole menu so I usually know what I am going to eat before I even walk into the place. I highly recommend the spring rolls ( with extra peanut sauce), any of the soups, the salads, and I get the number #23 noodle dish sometimes. The frozen coconut boba or the fried banana desert dish is bomb too. Whenever I take people to eat there for the first time it becomes their favorite Vietnamese spot to eat at too. I have gotten family and friends addicted to this place as well. Whenever I am in town I always stop by to eat here, even drive across town to get here.

2Jym5C966qNki3mcTQBzcw.text: Fresh food. Well mAde.good flavor. Lots on the menu. Each time I get something different. Each time it's better and better.  I was not a fan of the green tea ice cream. It was fresh and I am sure most people would like it.

mfNFq4_cHPBYtz7bC1hDhQ.text: I love when I get brave enough to try new cuisines, and then they turn out amazing. Little Saigon, a little house I've overlooked for years, delivers in flavor, value, and probably nutrition.   The vegetables are that good.   I started off with my very first banh xeo, a crunchy crepe filled with bean sprouts and some shrimp. Unlike French crepes that you can simply dig into, this dish will crumble as soon as you touch it. Use it as filling for a lettuce wrap, and if you're quirky like myself, enjoy the liberal portions of fresh mint and carrots that come along with it. It's still weird to me, but I'd eat it again.   My main course was some beef over bok choi, which was prepared perfectly. I have never had bok choi this tasty, and I'd definitely recommend it. I think it's the number 57, which shows you how many options they have.   For dessert, I went with a taro boba. It was way sweeter than I'm used to...but hey, it's a dessert, so what could I expect? Overall, I was satisfied with a very affordable meal in a clean, stylish environment. I would totes come back.

PjHlKD8FBmMnqFcHlAjiTA.text: Quaint little Vietnamese restaurant with quite the extensive menu, delicious flavors,  and welcoming staff. Worth going back when I'm in the area for sure. Not a bad thing at all from my experience. Portions are good. Dessert was delicious (Friend Bananas with Ice Cream). 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of Little Saigon - Glendale, AZ, United States. Strawberry Smoothie with Boba. DELICIOUS. Refreshing. I have had better &#39;boba&#39; though.

xV8BiLx4a417ijEgmltXjQ.text: Came here on a Saturday night expecting great food based on good reviews from Yelp!   Bad experience!   I had the spring rolls, pho tai and also the Vietnamese coffee.  The spring rolls were good and the pho was okay.  After I got home, I started having stomach pain and used the bathroom twice. rU61hJM-PbW-iMxT1AIoLw.text: So my family and I had this place for the first time about a week ago. Really good, the Pot-stickers are out of this world bursting with flavor and a must try with the sauce. We ordered one order of spring rolls.....we ate them so fast we had to order more. NlLBwz-1nRddiUVN9TQcVQ.text: I am so happy with this spot. The only thing missing for me is the Bahn Mi. Loved the spring rolls the pork is seasoned and grilled not boiled. This gives the roll a different taste. A very delicious taste. Shrimp was cooked perfectly not chewy. Peanut sauce is on point. I could eat just this for lunch and be satisfied. I did order the beef pho and enjoyed every drop of it. The broth is not not as aromatic as I am used to so maybe a first time pho eater would take to it. I like that it does come out piping hot which makes the first sip of broth just run through your soul. And that is an amazing feeling. Warms the tummy. The resteraunt is clean an cozy. Our waitress was very nice and extremely helpful. There is seating outside too. I will most definitely be back.

hnL8nr1_Epi-wq0Lguzf3A.text: Best Vietnamese restaurant in Phoenix. We have been coming here for years. It only gets better. I love the beef Pho and the shaved ice for desert.

co6hSZflI9ILzLQgcxZm_Q.text: This place is a staple of my diet and for very good reason! Every single item is busting with a variety of flavor and give you an authentic taste of Vietnam. I love the spring rolls with the peanut sauce that I could drink as a beverage if they would allow it. The #37 is my standard with marinated pork chop and grilled shrimp with a side of rice topped with a sunny side up egg. I thought it odd the first time with the egg on top but after enjoying the meal I couldn't think of the meal without it.  I love the pho as well but only during the winter months as soup in the summer never seems appetizing.   Trust me if you love Asian food varieties give this gem in downtown Glendale a shot and never look back

nYoZfbEdYg6fOfdkEk-vsQ.text: What's up with all the 1 star reviews?  Perhaps high maintenance reviewers?  This place is a solid 5 star experience.  Have eaten lunch there almost a dozen times.  The food is traditional Vietnamese.  By far the best in the Valley.  And if you've ever visted Vietnam you'd probably appreciate this place even more.   Only wish it wasn't a 40 minute drive!

MeWpiAMEh8HSf9rrEvrgaw.text: This place is the jam, and the boyfriend and I's go-to spot. The hours are a bit annoying, as sometimes you just miss them, but the food is great. I never really liked pho all that much before I went to this place. The rice bowls are great, the drinks are great, it's all worth writing home about  (or writing on Yelp about).

XZ902mqOML6_IU8O7LKiPQ.text: I absolutely love eating here for lunch! They have a lot of vegetarian options but you can always customize your dishes to make them vegan like I do. This place is very clean and cozy and has great customer service. To top it all off the food is delicious and authentic. I highly recommend it if you're in the area.

Ul-2OrhSGXMZq_izLTMrsg.text: Little Saigon has been my alternate choice for my Vietnamese food fix for some time. My first choice has been Pho Thanh, due how close it is, and the value. But Little Saigon's humble abode offers the best Bowl in the west side, and possibly in Arizona.   Their egg rolls are simple and small, but packed with flavor. And the fact that they do offer boba tea and an abundance of classic dishes should please any patron.  Now for the important part, the soup. There is only one size available, but it is the perfect amount. The shrimp was large enough and also detailed. The meat was also pretty big and cooked perfectly. The taste was so excellent.  Not only was the food wonderful, but the service is more than friendly and helpful to all of our requests. We have not had a bad meal here, and come here whenever we are in the area.
